text: Draught @ Fox & Hounds, Sønderborg. Pours hazy very dark brown with small but stable tan head. Clear aroma of roast and malt, wirh notes of yeast and coffee and hints of smoke. Bitter, roasty flavour with notes og hops and touches of coffee and yeast. Lingering, roasty aftertaste with estery hints. Not very smokey but good.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2017 Tap @F&H, Sdbg. Nearly black, seems clear, thick light beige head. Roasted aroma, faint smoke. Sweet, quite roasted, caramely flavour with light, woody smoke. Good, bittersweet lasting roast.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2017 Draught, 5.9%. Roasted and vinous aroma. Very dark brown colour. Good stable light brown head. The flavour starts off roasted and vinous as well. Turns more roasted and bitter after a while. Very light on the smoke in my opinion. But good, especially considering the moderate ABV.

It's midday. It's sunny but it's cold. The flames are out but there's still a wisp of smoke. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Keg @Stone, Berlin. Pours black, slight tan head. Nose is chocolate, malty, coffee, slight smoke. Taste is coffee, sweet milk chocolate, smoke and slight peat.

Draught. Dark brown with ruby reflections, with lovely beige head, lacing. Nose is, fuck, caramel, highly roast, toasted nuts, sweetness, cant find this smoke, we do it much better in Poland. Mouth: dominated with dried red fruits (cherry, prune, with prune in the foreground), not too intense. Sweet, quite low bitterness, weak roast, moderate body.
Too watery, very low co2. Overall: not any masterpiece, can be. Proves no sense in drinking simple porters while you have baltic porter next to. This beer doesnt know what real smoke is.

Aroma - ripe apple (it is definitely different than in cider, more pleasant) and very, very delicate aroma of smoke. So delicate that it s almost imperceptible. Beer is a little watery imo, but - at all - it may be good as a session beer.

W aromacie początkowo bardzo lekka wędzoność, lecz przypisałem to niskiej temperaturze, jednak taka już pozostała, opis piwa mówi o niej całą prawdę. Generalnie dosyć intensywny, przyjemny. Barwa ciemnobrązowa, piana kiepska, opadająca. W smaku wędzoność już jest intensywniejsza, piwo jest wytrawne, kawowe, umiarkowanie palone. Goryczka niska do średniej ,wysycenie w normie. Fajny klasyczny porter muśnięty wędzonką, jak dal mnie mogliby z tym pójść na całość, po piwo trochę bez charakteru.
One of my go to favorites, a full on porter, strong character with notes of chocolate and just a touch of smoke. A dear, dark friend.

Bottle. BBE date Sept 2011; Drank Aug 2011 - Black in colour with Deep Mahogany/Ruby tints. Moderately Malty; peat smoked malts, roasty, lots of coffee, some chocolate, caramel. Fruity; dark fruits. Hoppy; some balancing hop bitterness. The "smoke" is much subtler than a rauchbier; rather understated. Roast malty throughout with light smokiness. Good, but not as great as I hoped or expected. (2011-08-28)

1pt 6fl oz bottle at home from craft&draft, Amsterdam. Nose is smoked old wood, roasted malt, cardboard. Body is pitch black, head is small, beige, frothy, average lasting, good lacing. Aroma is dried fruits, old wood, light smoke, chestnut, biscuits, toast, milk chocolate. Medium sweet, medium bitter. Finish is medium lasting roasty medium bitter. Medium to full body, slick texture, average carbonation. Easy dessert beer, very unique, not too smoky, well balanced, rich aroma, tasty, great one.

Bomber. 2012 vintage. Big chocolate nose, with lots of dark fruit, a bit of coffee.... but no real smoke. Thick dark brown color (near black), and a 2cm. dark tan head. Thin chocolatey initial flavor, maybe milk sugar. The lightly smoked malt ramps up in mid palate, with some dark fruitiness, bit of licorice, and gentle bitterness. Finish is moderately dry. Medium body. Very mild smoke (in flavor only), which could be due to the age. Overall, not as aggressive as Id expected. But also feels a little boozier than 5.9%. Well balanced and tasty. Surprisingly good after four-five years in the bottle.

Poured from a bomber into a pint glass. The appearance is a near pitch black pour with a medium sized tan head. the aroma is a nice blend of smoke, malt and cocoa. The taste is malt driven with some smoke. An outstanding beer.
Pours dark brown/black with fairly high carbonation. Aroma is smoke with chocolate. Taste is smoked chocolate.

Pours a deep brownish black from the bomber with fluffy tan head that dissipates to leave moderate lace. Aroma of mild smoke, earth, tobacco, and roast. Taste is smokier than the nose, roast takes a back seat. Really solid, but the vanilla is better.
Black colour, off white head. Aroma of plums, slightly smokey, coffee. Taste is light sweet, slightly bitter. Light to medium body, silky texture, soft carbonation.
Very fine Porter. Highly drinkable with well hidden alcohol. Not so intensive in case of taste and aroma which are mostly roasted malts.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen (Stone TTO 27/11/2016) - pours black with a beige head. Aroma and taste is roasted malty, with coffee, chocolate, caramel, cocoa, decent hoppy backing, some charred smokey malty action into the finish.
From tap at Taphouse. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roated malt, coffee, caramel, alcohol, coffee, bitterness and vanilla.

A grown mans porter. Poured from a bomber interesting a tulip glass. The pour produces a dense 2 finger light tan head. The appearance is a rustic dark brown with a black core and garnet hue at the outer edges. The aroma is sweet caramel and bakers chocolate with smoke and small amount of wood and earth. The flavor is caramel up front with toasted and roasted grain. Then comes the smokey malt bomb. The finish is long and pleasantly dry.

Orange hue in the blackness. Dark chocolate nose. Lovely smooth body with a hint of smoke & full coffee flavour. A beautiful beverage.

Rated by BrewTom
Draught. Nice porter with medium strength smokiness and bit of sulphur notes in aroma. Medium body and carbonation, lightly bitter in finish. Quite OK, but I expected more smoky beer.

Visual: Pours dark walnut brown with a smallish dissipating head, thin ringed microfine retention, micro streams all around.

Nose: brown sugar barley malts, caramel. (lvl-6)-intensity

Attack: smooth-crisp

Mid-palate: roasted barley malt with underlying coffee sourness, dark chocolate, (lvl-5-sweetness),

Finish: bitter roast, bitter hops,

Summary: The complexity is certainly there and the flavour transitions are seamlessly smooth. Some smoke, but rather reserved and refined - Great balance and finesse.

22 oz bottle shared by ebone1988 for the fucking book because I guess I pissed someone off in a past life. Thanks a lot. The pour is a darker ruby/light brown with a lot of translucency and a thick ivory colored head that slowly falls down to a thick collar and film. The aroma is not good. There is a ton of metallic malt and a strong smokiness. A hint of chocolate and a light roast really bring up the back end of this shit show. The flavor is smokey garbage. There is a thin metallic malt and a ton is smoke. Its got a light chocolate happening but its just a mess. The mouth feel is thin and slick with a very light carbonation and a lingeringly smokey and metallic malt finish. This is smokey water and Im quite unhappy.

Bottle shared with koleminer20, for the book. Best by March16, 2016. Yikes. Aroma is metallic, smoky, roasted malt, some alcohol, pretty one-dimensional. Appearance is brown red, light light tan head, poured extremely thin. Taste is very smoky, bready, roasted malt, robust, metallic, but as advertised. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, smoky metallic aftertaste. Overall, not as bad as I expected.
Pours a rich dark brown with deep red notes from a bottle. Peaty coffee and chocolate aroma, flavor is similar with a slight hint of Moxie. Turns a little creosote-y on the finish. Okay beer.

22 ounce bottle into pint glass, best before 8/28/2015. Pours crystal clear deep reddish brown color with a 2 finer dense and fluffy khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Aromas of big chocolate, cocoa, caramel, toasted brown bread, wood smoke, herbal, mint, pepper, light coffee/nuttiness, and roast/toasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and compelxity of dark/roast/smoked malt and light-moderate earthy hop notes; with great strength. Taste of big chocolate, cocoa, caramel, toasted brown bread, wood smoke, herbal, mint, pepper, light coffee/nuttiness, and roast/toasted earthiness. Light-moderate herbal/spicy hop and light roasted bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of chocolate, cocoa, caramel, toasted brown bread, wood smoke, herbal, mint, pepper, and roast/toasted earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/smoked malt and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light dryness from bitterness, increasing through the glass. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, creamy, and lightly sticky/chalky balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5.9%. Overall this is an excellent smoked American porter style. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/smoked malt and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; very smooth and easy to drink. Its unfortunate that this one is being retired this year, but at least the homebrew recipe will always be available. A very enjoyable offering.
From the "how have I not already rated this? file. As a rauchbier fan Id love to see even more smoke; theres plenty of chocolate and coffee to keep it from just tasting like smoke.

Originally rated on 9/20/09. Stones smoked porter poured a black body, quickly disappearing tan head. Aroma was rather faint of chocolate, roasted malt, even a little fruit. Mouthfeel was a little thin but o.k. The smoked flavor is nice but goes away rapidly leaving the roasted malt aftertaste.
Bottle at beerbistro. Very smoky aroma, freshly roasted coffee. Very dark brown with thin tan head that lingered. Roasty flavour, with nice coffee, leather. Bitter finish. Pretty good.

Deep dark amber, 2 fingers khaki foam. Nose is dark smoked malt. Bittersweet. Middle is charred malt, coffee grounds, molasses, and woody hops. Finish is bittersweet and long, with one last whiff of smoke. Nice.
Black with off white head - Smoked malt aroma - Smoked malt bodythat has some bitterness to it - The smoked malts goes into the finish - This was good
Purvis Cellars bottle(8-Jun-16)Plum smoke light herbal aroma.Brown red,low head&suds lace.Choc berry herbal flavour.Herbal berry finish&astringent aftertaste.
Dark black with little head. Tastes mildly sweet, light smoke wood. Nice. Oddly, very smokey burp afterwards.

Bottle, 2013 vintage. Pours black, nice tan head, pretty lacing. Aroma is smoke, but toned down compared to fresh based on what Im hearing. Nice sweet chocolate, roasted malt. Wood, and a bit of leather too. Flavor is smokey, oak, decent bit of smoke. Its non negligible. Its nice. I think the age has brought out the chocolate. Hard to say for sure without a frame of reference. But very good.
Pour. Thin head, almost unnoticeable. Very little carbonation; thick. Burnt palate, bit of coffee on the lips, malt finish.

Draught at BGM 4
Aroma-caramel, coffee, smoke, sour
Appearance-brown, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, medium sourness, light sweetness, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-interesting
Bomber. Pours dark brown with a tan head and smokey, chocolate aroma. Taste is pretty and smokey with roasted malt, chocolate, and some dark fruit notes into the finish

With Z over ribs, pours pitch black with a Java head. Nose is malt, black coffee and smoke ! Taste is smokey, with heavy malt, chocolate and espresso ! Finishes on the same heavy malty chocolate notes with a moderately long smoky ending . Nice ! Quaff Score 8 / 10
Draft and bottles over the years... cant believe this rating isnt in. Dark pour with some light head. Roasted, chocolate, smoke malt aromas. Flavors are dark, sweet, roasted and smoke tones.

Bottle from LCBO. BB 27.06.2016. Pours dark brown with beige head. Good retention. Aromas smoky indeed but luckily not in a greasy ham kinda way but very mellow and mixes well with the chocolaty and caramelly sweet and cold coffee. Tastes pretty sweet, chocolate and perhaps bits of caramel plus creamy, lactic notes. Astringent bitter burn in the finish. Lots of development as it warms - more subtle nuances come to the fore like vanilla, cocoa and even tart red berries. Crisp carbonation, low mediumish body and dryish ashy on the palate. Good.

Pours black with nice tan head. Not a strong smell. Taste is rich but slightly tangy with a strong finish of smoke which I love. Very nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tasting session @ Budapest.
 Light smoked aroma, coffee and toasted malts. Medium sweet and bitter, well balanced. Medium body, soft carbonation. Really nice porter
Roodbruine, bijna zwarte kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt zoetig, koffie, vanille, crème. Smaakt koffie, vanille, chocolade. Beetje gerookt.
Donker bruin bier met een kleine beige schuim kraag. Ruikt gerookt, spek, zout, hoppig. Smaakt hoppig, koffie, geroosterd.
Donkerbruin, dun schuim. Ruikt naar chocola. Ook erg lekkere chocola smaak. Prima!

[tap in Jabeerwockie, Warsaw]
Appereance Dark brown with nice foam (small and average bubbles). Head didnt last too long, it reduced to subtle ring. Nice lacing.
Aroma: flat, a bit sour. Roasty notes: coffee, milk chocolate with a bit of nuts. On third (fourth) plan I feel smoked notes - Im not really sure, if I make me believe I feel... A little bit honey and sweet red fruits.
Taste aroma was subtle, but taste is even more flat.. Watery, with very delicate roasted hints: coffee, chocolate, wood. Smoked notes near limit of perception, very weak. A little bit of caramel and bread. Pretty dispappointing.
Mouthfeel and bitterness: tart and a little sour. High level of taninns intensifies bitterness, making it sharp and long. Body is flat and thin, watery...
Overall
At first sip I thought it was mild ale. Thin, light and flat. Hardly noticable smoked notes, too weak. Very poor beer, unfortunately...
Tasting at Beer station, Xiamen. Pours dark brown red with an off white head. Aroma of roast malt, chocolate, coffee. Bitter finish.

Tap na GBM. Przyzwyczajony do poziomu wędzonki na jaki trafiam w polskich piwach, tutaj się nieco zawiodłem. Rozumiem koncept, że ma to być jedynie dodatek, ale tutaj było to minimalne muśnięcie dla mnie. Brakowało mi tej dymności i w aromacie i w smaku. Przez to też trochę bazowe piwo miało mało charakteru.
Tap (BGM4). Bardzo fajny, wędzony porter. Wędzonka niezbyt intensywna, słodowa, piwo ładnie zbalansowane, pijalne i dość lekkie jak na porter.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2016 650ml bottle. Pours a fairly thick frothy creamy brownish head and has a very dark brown appearance with ruby highlights. Lacing is fairly thick and dirty. Aromas of toasted malts, barley, smokey and mild spice notes. Flavours are somewhat sweet at first but has much more smokey notes afterwards. Lots of toasty and roasted malt flavours. Smooth and slick mouthfeel. Good retention.
Tapped by Hopfenkult Dresden, medium body, dark black beer, flat carbonation, long bitter finish, very good balanced

5.9%ABV. Porter.

Tapped out black. 40ºSRM.

Nose has ume, smoked and stout like nose. Nose has oatmeal fullness, raw grain body. Floury.

Mouthfeel is sudsy. There is ton of carbonation on this one. Palate has a ton of smoke, like someone poured liquid smoke into the brew. The grain bill is represented in a palate that is sweet, oatmeal thick and with a oatmeal, raw flour body. Smoky bitter with dark chocolate, espresso, black coffee,

Finish is clean and dry. Really finishes like a stout with English bitters. The only thing that is a little incongruous is the hoppy bitter finish.

Very nice. I like this very much. Im just not very sure what I had. I was told this was the smoked porter.
Pours black brown with a beige head. Great smoked malt aroma. Rich coffee and chocolate taste with a good smokey background. Great winter beer.

Draught at Braukunst Live 2016 - FR2, the modest all-draught Stone Berlin stand slackly manned by manchildren doubled up in a helix of deep Cali-Berlin relaxation. - Thinnish auburn pour. Whispy toasted more than smoked caramalt aromatics, beechwood twigs and shrub in a watery puddle. Burnt toffee, sterile earth layers, chocolate dusted cracker - then soon becomes trademark pine bitter to develop an astringency I personally am not after when ordering a porter, not even a smoked one. A look at the Berlin-brewed style sheet teaches the deterred tongue that this porter is endowed with 51 IBUs. Manages to drink both watery and annoyingly astringent - either its the kegs, the new batches or my palate has outgrown Stone monothematic pinehop shock tactics before really settling into them. Still looking forward to tasting the canned results in summer!
Pours black with cream coloured head. No smoke to speak of but strong burnt malt and bitter charcoal/coffee. Not a long finish.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Dark brown color with tan head. Aroma is smokey, roasted, some berries. Taste is similar. Extremely dry. Nice mouthfeel! Not bad.
Bottle from LCBO. Roasty grapey and slightly smoky aroma. Roasty bitter taste, dark fruit, and light smoke. Tasty.

From tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels. Aroma is smoked malt, coffee, some chocolate, roast. Flavour is light to moderate sweet with a nicely bitter finish. Medium bodied. Excellent balance between the smoke and the other flavours.

Smoked beer! Tough to beat anything smoked for me. This is nicely hopped, deeply complex, with hints of chocolate & even licorice. Would be great with anything smoky, like BBQ or even a hamburger. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle; pours dark brown with a tan head; aroma of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, and a hint of smoke; taste is bittersweet chocolate with some roasted coffee, caramel, and hints of smoke and dark fruits; finish is dry with some light bitterness; excellent porter

650 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours an orange-tinged dark brown with nice light tan head. Aroma is moderately smoky with chocolate, toffee and some herbal bitterness. Flavour is fairly smoky with cocoa, toffee, a little coffee and a bit of herbal character. Lingering smoke and tar in finish. Nice.
Gorgeous pour with a bubbly head that lasts for weeks. The aroma is coffee, hops and a bit of smoke. The taste is more coffee, bitter chocolate, roasted malts and dark fruit. Top notch.

Aroma: smoke, roasty, chocolate, 
Appearance: brown-black with a beige head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, light smoke
Palate: medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Tasty

Tap @ Beer Temple, sample size. Very dark color, but not quite black/opaque. Frothy, light beige head. Aromas: light smoke, light roasted, very mild really. Retronasal theres a bit more to it: smokey, roasted malts. Flavor is roasted, hardly sweet. Light bodied. Finishes with light tar, moderate bitter.

650 mL bottle. Decent looking beer, with a sticky tan head. A little smoke in the nose, but the aroma is fairly mild. Its subtle in the flavour as well, appearing at the start and lingering in the finish. In between, its more typical porter flavours, although its not as roasty as some. It is, however, more bitter in the finish than most. Not sure what to think of that. It feels like a hoppy bitterness, rather than from roasted malt.

Cervesa on destaquen els tocs torrats de xocolata i de cafè però amb un toc fumat.
Cerveza dónde destacan los toques tostados de chocolate y de café pero con un toque ahumado.
Overpriced bomber from the LCBO. Cocoa, coffee, sweet, dark malt, light smoke, mild bitterness. Solid.

Tap at the Great Beer Bar, Petaling Jaya, Malaysia. Poured a clear reddish brown with a frothy off white head. The aroma is toffee caramel malt light smoky roast malt. The flavour is moderate liqourice bitter, light sweet with a soft smooth sweet smoky malt, light hop bitter palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation.

Dark brown pour with a fine tan head. Smells like dark cherries, roasted grains, a bit of whiskey, peat, smoke. The taste is bitter, with notes of peat, smoke, dark cherries and dark chocolate. Silky smooth texture with medium body and a bitter and smoky aftertaste.
LE: when the beer gets warmer, one can identify other notes: funky sour notes in the nose, together with caramel, and the taste also contains notes of caramel and a bit of vanilla. Pretty complex beer.
Bottle pour Dark brown with a large soapy tan head with a lot of lacing. Smokey malt aroma with chocolate and coffee. Medium body. Lasting salty taste.

Rated from old notes. A California porter with a rich smokey taste. This is not a pronounced smokiness like Schlenkerla, but much more subdued. Chocolate undertones. Aftertaste reminds more of a milk stout than a porter. Very good.

Fairly pronounced smokiness in the aroma but the taste is really where the smoked malt comes through. Very smooth, black pour with a quickly dissipating tan head. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a bottle. Deep brown, not quite opaque, with a medium head of tan foam. Medium to thin body. Not much of an aroma. Medium carbonation. Slightly bitter and harsh with just a hint of smoke. Not very smooth, flavorful or refreshing. Not that enjoyable, somewhat disappointing. Could have been a little thick, smoother, with bolder flavors.

650ml bottle. Pours a clear mahogany with a red hue and a large, long lasting, beige head that laces nicely. Sweet aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate, dark fruit, licorice, coffee and a hint of smoke. Sweet flavour of roasted malt, dark chocolate, licorice, dark fruit, coffee, smoke and caramel with a dry, bitter, hoppy finish. Medium body with a smooth, creamy, oily texture and soft carbonation. Well balanced. Very nicely done. An excellent porter.

Delicious traditional smoked porter. Subtly smoked,light with big coffee and chocolate notes in the malt. Subtle, rounded fruity hops. Brings back memories of wintertime evening drinking at blind tiger on W10th for some reason.

Pours dark brown with persistent beige head. Light smoked aroma, coffee and toasted malts. Medium sweet and bitter, well balanced. Medium body, soft carbonation. Really nice porter, with a subtle smoked touch.

November 26, 2015. Bottled july 8, 2015. 
Dark Brown, almost black with a medium sized, quite creamy beige head. Aroma is soft smoked malt, licorice, caramel, hints of cocoa, sweet coffee and hints of ink. Taste is medium sweet, soft bitter. Finish is sweet caramel and licorice, light smoke, very soft bitter roasted coffee and chocolate. Medium bodied, slight creamy texture, average carbonation. 
Soft smoked easy drinkable porter,

Had at Matt's when Theresa was round. Opaque black, beige fluffy head, big fluffy lacing. Smells of dusty (mothball-ish though not in bad way) dry roasted cereal malt. Taste is medium to heavy bitterness, roast/burnt malt, somewhat thin. Body is thin, burnt malt, small carbonation. Not that smoky, dusty nose, taste and palate kind of thin.
On tap at Stone company store, Pasadena. Nice porter base, roastiness, subtle smoke adds to that. rare soft touch for Stone. Really well balanced. Very nice beer.

Rating #1296 - 21.10.2014 - Stone launch @craftbeeryeg Nice deep dark color with a darker foamy tan head. Aroma is espresso, chocolate, smoked almonds. Mouthfeel is creamy, medium alcohol warmth, low carbonation. Taste is complex, lots of toasted malt notes, hints of cocoa, almond nuttiness, lingering bitterness. Extraordinary.
Bottle. Black colour with tan head. Smoked and peated aroma. Roasted, smoked, coffee taste. Medium body.
Smell of malt, cacao, dark coffee, come with deep dark brown color with thick tan head, straightforward porter with toasty malt and coffee, slightly slimy text. Good and simple
Taste is crisp, slightly smokey, chocolate malt and coffee notes. Dark brown color,semi opaque, full body, pair well with BBQ

Appearance: clear amber-brown, one fat finger of creamy light tan head, good retention and lacing. (4/5) Aroma: smoke, roasty malt, mild chocolate and coffee. (8/10) Taste: moderate sweet, mild bitter, light smoke. (8/10) Medium-full creamy body, moderate carbonation, short duration slightly smoky finish. (4/5)

Good looking and nicely balanced, with the smoke being definitively present, yet not overwhelming. Pretty simple flavours, with just the basics on both the nose and tongue, but decently done. (16/20)

Bottle 65cl / Botella 65cl.
@ Best Damn Beer Shop, San Diego, CA, USA.
A: Black / Negro.
T/S: Roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, slightly smoky / Malta tostada, cafe, chocolate, ligeramente ahumado.
Bottle - pours black with lacy head. Mild smoky aroma, roast malt. Roast malt taste with a smoky note. Creamy palate.

Kran w Jabeerwocky

Aromat: jedynie lekko wędzony, estrowy z nutą anyżu. Nie przekonuje.


Wygląd: barwa ciemno brązowa, nieprzejrzysta. Piana beżowa, drobno pęcherzykowa, dość obfita i umiarkowanie trwała, ale ładnie oblepia szkło.


Smak: wyraźna nuta wędzona, następnie śliwki suszone oraz czekolada deserowa. Niezbyt złożona. Goryczka powyżej średniej, drażniąca i dosyć długa, ale nie odrzuca. Średnia pełnia, umiarkowane wysycenie i kwaskowo- palony finisz. Jak na tak kultowe piwo to zdecydowanie nie olśniewa.

A 22 fl oz bomber with a bottled on date of 17th July 2015 and an enjoy by date of 14th November 2015. Poured into a Spiegelau stout glass. It poured a dark dark brown colour with a light amber hue and a nice two fingered tan head that dissipates slowly leaving stringy lacing. Aromas are smoky, roasted malts with some light chocolate and cream. Tastes are of roasted malts and bittersweet chocolate. There is also some light smoke which is ashy and hints of licorice and milk coffee. Creamy, smooth, medium bodied with light to medium carbonation. The smoke taste was a bit ashy for me, but otherwise this was a nice smoked porter.

A very good regular porter, but I expected something more from Stone. Classic 100%, no smoke detected. Black with white head, dark malts aroma, light cocoa and coffee in taste. Smooth and quaffable. Yes, good, but "underachieving"
Dark cola colored with thin tan head and minimal lacing. Smells of raisin, leather and licorice. Taste is heavily roasted malt and coffee with a smokey finish. A bit on the dry side for my tastes.

650 mL bottle. Dark brawn amber pour, tight tan head. Aroma of heavier malt, woodiness, leather, not a ton of smoke. Taste is lighter than expected from the nose, much more of a malty smoke affair. Dry finish, slightly oily body.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 kran w jabeerwocky. zaskakujaco delikatne piwo - owocowe, palone, kawowe, tej wedzonosci z nazwy dosc malo (zgodnie z opisem - to fragment calosci), slodkie, czekoladowe, sliwkowe, grejfrutowe, w tym wszystkim lekkie... bardzo fajne, niepokojaco latwo przyswajalne :)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Piwo ciemnobrązowe, piana ładna, beżowa i dość trwała . W aromacie kawa, czekolada i wyraźne owoce suszone, które zasłaniają wędzoność. W smaku kawowe, goryczka średnia. Wytrawne. Wysycenie niskie.
Large Format - Very dark and rich black color. Nice rich head that stuck around for a while. A slight hop smell and smoky smell as well, oak. Very Dry hop flavor with only a slight smoky flavor.
Tap at Brewcraft. Smoke not overly present. Standard porter. A bit empty. Not bad
Negro con reflejos caoba y espuma beis densa. Aromas ligeros ahumados, café y chocolate. Cuerpo medio con intenso sabor de café y chocolate amargo que permanece hasta el regusto.

Malty, roasted, little cappucino, coffee and caramel. Just edgy subtily smoked. Nice dark colour with a nice off white head. Good carb. Nice malty, dry roasted and a little smoked flavour. Lots of (subtile) flavours. Caramel, maple and a bit of hay. Great!
On tap at ATR Bethesda. Dark brown body with large head. Nose is malts, and coffee and chocolate. Taste also smoky, chocolate. Nice hoppy finish.

Just an amazing brew. A little leather in the smell. The smokeyness is not overwhelming but adds layers of taste and depth. It tastes like chocolate,berries, a litte peat, rounded coffee, vanilla in the end. A tiny bitterness. Lots of satisfaction. With this abv it ir remarkable how much taste they put inside. Highly recommended.

---Rated via Beer Buddy (iOs)

Tap 0.5 l, ZUP, Wrocław, Poland.
Ciemnobrązowe piwo z beżową, puszystą i trwałą pianą oraz kawowo-czekoladowym aromatem. W smaku gęste, głównie wyczuwalna palona kawa z czekoladowymi nutami, lekko podwędzane i kwaskowe z wytrawnym posmakiem na finiszu.
Very nice drinkable beer. Smoke is subtle, body medium but not watery. Enough roasted notes. Quite good, not incredible
Poured deep dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of sweet fruit and rauched malt. Medium body, flavour as the aroma, medium sweet, moderately rauched.

Bottle, BB 28/08/15. Appearance is very dark mahogany brown, with a 1-2 finger pillowy beige head which slowly subsides. Aroma- chocolate first and foremost, dark malts, caramel, burnt toast, tobacco smoke hints. Taste- barbecue smoke, burnt malts, chocolate milkshake, bitter coffee grounds, biscuity caramel. Smooth mouthfeel, with some carbonation in the background. Very nice stuff.
Meaty and smokey aroma with notes of especially chocolate. Taste is equally smokey, somewhat subtle though, with notes of chocolate, coffee and a quite dry finish.
Keg at Brewdog Edinburgh. Pours clear red brown with a thin beige head. Aromas of smoke and chocolate, light charcoal. Taste is chewy, light smoke, dry finish.
66 cl bottle @ home. Pours brown with a tan head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are roasted malt, chocolate, and a little smoke - with a roasted finish.

Always have enjoyed this. Big but subtle smoked malt and chocolate aroma. Dark brown but not solid color with a full head. Medium to light body. Flavor is complimenting smoke to a roasted chocolate base with earthy and woody tones. Hops give it a solid bitter and dry finish.
Rated based on notes taken 16 Mar 2014 -- A 2012 bottle we drank at a bottle share. This beer held up extremely well. Delish.

22 bomber to cervoise. Pours ruby-black, brown head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, toffee, smoke and toasted malts. Taste is the same with tamed hop bitterness. Finish is milky, cocoa, toast and coffee. Dry finish. Mouthfeel is medium-light with light carb.

Ah, Stone Smoked Porter. You tasty, tasty bastard, you. Ive shared good times with your Vanilla-infused sibling, but youre just as delicious all by yourself, arent you? Wait, why am I starting this review by addressing the beer? Why did I think that was a good idea? Forget it. Stone Smoked Porter smells like coffee, chocolate, and smoke. It tastes like it smells. The peat character and acrid bitterness are subtle enough not to be overpowering but assertive enough to enhance the roasted malts. Mouthfeel is dry and robust. Honestly, I wasnt able to drink enough of this to make me happy. Smoked Porter made me a better person in the short time it was in front of me.
Brown with tan head. Smoke, ash and caramel. Sweet, ash and oak finish. Overall: nice ashy notes. The rest is quite casual.
Bottled. Pours pitch black with a big brown head. Smells and tastes coffee, roasted malt, smoked meat and bread malty with a similar finish.

Bottle. 8/15/15 code date. Appearance: deep brown with a ruby undertone. Nearly opaque but clear under light. Light brown foam head. 
Aroma: Roasted malt prominent, with a hint of smoked wood. 
Taste: Medium malt sweetness, with a prominent roast character. Strong bitterness, and a light, leathery, woody, smoke character after the swallow. 
Mouthfeel: Light to medium body, almost a bit thin, with light carbonation. 
Finish: chocolate roast on the finish, with a light smoke character that lingers retronasally. 
Overall: A pretty solid robust American Porter with an underlying smoke character to compliment, not overpower.
I love the smokiness to this beer, I was surprised by how light the abv is. the coffee notes on the backend are amazing. really solid offering by stone.
Keg at Brewdog Edinburgh. Pours dark ruby. Nose is subtle smoke, dried fruits, dark malts, toffee, resin. Taste is light roasted malts, light smoke, dry toffee, dry bitter finish.

Almost black color with a tan head. Mild smoked, toffee and coffee in the aroma. Medium (+) body and an ok carbonation. Ok balance between sweetness and bitterness. Mild smoked, toffee, coffee and some chocolate in the flavor. Decent smoked ale even for me.[On tap at Steampunk Bar in Gothenburg, Sweden]

Bottle to snifter. Dark amber pour with a decent-sized off-white head thats gone quickly. Chocolate, raisins, figs, salt and smoke in the aroma. Flavor is chocolate, figs, pine hops, some bourbon notes, and liquid smoke. The smoke isnt overpowering at all.
On tap @ Steam Punk Bar. Dark brown with a small brown head. Malty and roasted tones. Malt, coffee, smoke, and hops. Medium body with a balanced finish.

Bomber. Clear deep dark copper, lasting dense creamy beige foam. Aroma of chocolate, treacle and mild smoke. Taste is medium roast, caramel, chocolate, dark fruit, some coffee, light smoke, slightly sweet, lightly bitter. Average carbonation, medium bodied, moderately hopped. Very yummy but: NFL (Not For Lagerboys)

From a 65 cl bottle bought at the Stone on Tap event at Amsterdams BeerTemple and picked up there during Carnivale Brettanomyces. Thin, off-white, light yellowish beige head over a hazy deep wine red coloured beer with a slight ochre hue. Aroma of pure, bitter chocolate, black olives, smoked horse meat, dried lemon peel, cigar ashes, iodine, vanilla, soy sauce and bayleaf, acquiring a delicate sweetness when warming up, not unlike milk chocolate, sweet cherry jam and caramel candy; in all, delicate and refined as usual with Stone, and less smokey than expected. Equally delicate flavour profile, clean onset with light spiciness and an oily, lean mouthfeel, rather thin actually for this style, umami flavours (olives), low fruitiness, sourish touch; finish of nice but subtle smokiness (smoked bacon), noble caramel maltiness and peppery and very lightly citrussy hops. The smoke character is very delicately incorporated in this one, allowing other flavours to shine. Great, but the body still could have been thicker for the style.

Date: June 272015... Glassware: Victory no nick.... Occasion: a cold June night lingers on---with Game of Thrones to ponder and rue... Appearance: dark black, intimidating body that allows an equally ominous brown head that webs archways across the glass in artful fashion; a thick half-inch ring holds staunchly; walls of head blanket the glass as it drains.... Aroma: a soft, milky whisp of lactic activity; some chocolate, licorice and some citric hops, the usual Stone calling card.... Palate: smooth, sensibly sippable; medium-bodied, creamy and softly carbonated; a drinkable porter... .Taste: milky, chocolatey, but rather subdued in its profile, almost apologetic in its assertiveness; a malty finish ensures a pleasant, roasted profile...Overall: A smooth, mildly flavorful example of the style--not nearly as prolific as the bottles script proclaims...a welcome but unworthy follow-up to the Founders Breakfast Stout...

650 ml bottle. Pours a dark clear brown with full head. Aromas of dark sweet fruit, tobacco, and oily smoke. Flavors of same with a bit more emphasis on candied dark fruit over smoke - which is great.

Smooth and rich. With coffee and chocolate. Just a little to much smoke flavor for me. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Lukt: Kaffe, bek, lakris.
Utseende: Sort.
Skum/kullsyre: Dekkende brunt skum, heng langs kant.
Smak: Kaffe, lakris,anelse sjokolade.

its an average porter. poors a dark brown and minimal head and lacing. Aroma of smoked malt and coffee. There is a definitive hop presence in the taste and the malt, chocolate and coffee is an aftertaste.

Not my favorite porter, but I cant say Ive not enjoyed it. Pours chocolate brown, splotchy head, average lace and low carbonation. The aroma is smoky malt, coffee, caramel. The flavor is hoppier than many porters, the malt is more reserved (this is, after all, Stone). The coffee and chocolate mentioned on the label come through in the finish.
Smell of smoked malt. Black colour, beige head. Aroma of smoked malt, ash. Very bitter. Dry palate, ashy texture. Flat carbon.
Poured from a bottle. Great, fantastic frothy head and lacing. An unexpected aroma, more malty than anything else. But the taste is as advertised, chocolate and coffee. Great finish.

Pours clear dark brown with low off-white head. Aroma of german sausage, smoke, wet burnt wood. Taste is smooth smoky and vanilla sweet with light chocolate and coffee bitter finish. Light, smooth body with soft carbonation.
Coffee and toffee aroma, dark black pour with nice tan head. Flavor of porter character on coffe and some caramel. Finishes pretty clean and no heat. Good drinking brew

650 ml bottle.

Dark brown, bordering on black. Nice light tan head. Good strips of lacing. 
Nose is very soft. Roast, earth, chocolate, earthy, slight smoke, and chalk. Odd.
.
Taste is very chalky. Like paste or eating chalk. Not very tasty. Little to no smoke. More like over hopped . rough to drink and hard to finish. Previous batches were much better. This was not.
Dark, savoury aromas and flavours, with a bit of stewed fruits poking through. Well balanced smoked malt use it never becomes overbearing.

26th May 2015: on a four beer flight at the Stone Oceanside outlet. Dark and foreboding brew, burnt coffee esters fill the nose with a smoky trace or two. Taste similar, coffee and smoky. Slightly bitter finish. Decent.

Black, darker than usual for a porter. Aroma is weak and flavor is like a porter with thin mouthfeel, maybe even dry, and a very strong smoky flavor. This should be had with BBQ. Some chocolate I didnt care for but also cola and a bit of hops to balance but not very bitter. Very malty and a bit of caramel.
Bottle at tasting. Black brown pour, small head. Aroma of roasted malt, cacao and a little caramel. Taste has mild smoke, soft roast, cacao, coffee and caramel malt. No peat actually.
Pours dark brown with a big creamy tan head. Aroma of smoke, roasted malt & chocolate. Taste is similar. Bitter finish.
Old rating. Black pour with off white head. Slight smoke, chocolate, dark fruits, coffee. Roasty and creamy, nice.

Overhopped, bitter, somewhat rancid. Im wondering if I got a bad bottle, because I cannot fathom how this beer is enjoying such a high overall rating on Ratebeer. 

Yuck. Almost a pour-out. Tastes like someone dropped a cigarette butt in a bottle of Big Rock Traditional Ale.
Bottle. Dark pour with a light beige head. Smoky aroma with coffee and chocolate. Roasted bitter hoppy taste with coffee finish.

22 oz bottle. Tasted on 4/4/15. Bottle courtesy of Espo. This had a pretty mild smoked element to it & was pretty well balanced with the chocolate & Mike bitterness. Pretty nice overall.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, finally getting a chance at this. We get most of the flavored varieties here, but never the plain?! Anyway, deep brown beer, decent almond colored head, good lacing. Aroma dried plum, coffe, smoke, toasted barley. Taste is toasted barley, faint fruit, coffee. Palate a bit light, carbonation a bit sharp, for style. I like the hops at the finish, this is almost dry.
One of my favorite porters, dont really drink many porters these days, this would be right on top of my list..

Incredible deal and wonderful aroma and taste of coffee and chocolate. Good and quite as heavy bitterness in the aftertaste that fills the mouth for a long while. Exquisite beer and enjoyable. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Pours a very dark brown with a tanned head. Sweet malt aroma with notes of smoke. Smokey taste.
Dark pour with tan head. Aromas of smoke, roasted malts, chocolate, spruce. Well balanced between smoke, roasted malts, and a sprucey bitter finish. Good.

From bottle to tulip. Aroma of restrained chocolate and coffee. Moderate cedar. Pours brown with ruby highlights. Light brown head sustains around the outside with large bubbles. Very limited lacing. Taste is moderate high peaty, which predominates over the other flavors. Moderate low biscuit, and slight semi-sweet chocolate. Moderate high bitterness.
Couleur brune foncés translucide avec un col beige moyennement résistant. Aromes de caramel, café, chocolat, un petit coté fumé. Rien dextraordinaire pour moi...

Bottle at home split with Sarah. Aroma is woody, ranch malts, bit of wet socks, charred wood and some caramel sweetness. There is some refried bean thing on the nose as well. Dark copper / mahogany brown coloured pour with a lasting frothy light cream coloured head. Flavour is composed of charred wood, roast, some lactose sugars, ashy roast, earthy smoke. Some little dried fruit and subdued smoke character. Palate is medium bodied, slightly creamy, milky on the tongue, highish carbonation. Decent smoked beer.

Old rating on 22oz bomber. Pours a deep dark brown with ruby highlights and a quickly dissipating tan head. Molasses, brown sugar and roasted grain aromas present with a hint of smokiness on the nose. Nice carbonation. Oily mouthfeel. Solid porter but the smokiness is also muted on the palate. Good finish.

On tap at Middletown Fine Wine and Spirits. Pours dark brown with some red highlights. Aromas of coffee and smokiness. Flavors of coffee and chocolate with a little toasted marshmallow. Palate is light to medium. Nice lacing in the glass. Very nice porter.

Poured from 22oz bottle into tulip. Aroma is hoppy at first, then smoked malt, maybe a little earthiness. Beer is dark brown in color with a tan head which dissipates quickly leaving a fair amount of lacing. Taste is lightly sweet to a lightly bitter finish. Medium body with a slightly oily texture. Carbonation is average. 

Overall good beer

Good example of a smoked porter. 

Only paid $5.50 for 22oz bottle. Most other brews in 22oz on shelf were averaging $9.99 some as high as $14.99. For $5.50 it was well worth it, I will buy again at some point.
Perfect smoke porter, great thing is that this porter does not have the mesquite phenolics most smoke brews do. Great smoky roast aroma, nice body but nit stout like, clean clean finish. Great beer.

Bottle: medium dense to dark with a reddish hue, clear, thick head and great lace. Malt, roasted coffee, dry brown spice. Its not really that smoke. Medium intensity. Dry, not sour and low bitterness. Dominated by malt. Roasted and burnt but not smokey. Great CO2. Nice depth and length. 
Good port but not a great beer.
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is chocolate, toffee, smoky, taste is similar, dry.
Strong but not to Arrogant like their others. Just also bear in mind, this is bomber 4

Aroma is caramel, chocolate, vanilla beans, roasted malts and smoked grains. Taste is rich but fairly smooth malts balanced with medium clove and slight tanin hop character. The malt profile finishes slightly watered down but solid overall. Appearance is a clear dark amber with a thin pearl head that retains fairly well.

This beer had quite a hiss when I opened from the bottle and I got quite a bit of smoke. The beer poured a clear dark brown with some red shining through it when I held it up to the light and I got a thick beige head that left some good lacing around the glass. The aroma is dark roasted barley, some smoke, small amount of chocolate and coffee. The taste is dark burnt roasted barley where it probably gets some of the slight smokiness. The smoke is not overpowering, it is quite balanced. I also pick up some faint bitter chocolate but not much. The mouthfeel is on the medium side and is quite creamy. There is not much of a hop presence but there is a little bit of bitterness to balance the beer out.

Dark with a creamy off white head. Good head retention with plenty of legs on the glass. Molasses, bbq, Brown suger, caramel, bitter and slight coffee aroma. Creamy but not thick, bitter, charcoal, coffee and dark coffee flavors. The smoke/peat flavor is lacking but overall I like it. Great buy at just under $5.

In the spirit of a recent forum discussion Im going to say that this beer was cheap, but tastes expensive. It also tastes cold and it tastes dark. Regrettably what it does not taste like is smokey. I understand that Stone wanted this to be a Porter first and foremost, but I dont have to like that, Id rather have smokey.

Pours a deep, dark brown, bordering on black body. Thin, yet consistent tan head with substantial lacing. Rich and complex nose; cacao nibs, coffee, and peat. Dark fruit and possible berries come through. Fantastic taste, layered with roasty malts and spicy espresso flavors. Dark chocolate, oaky, woody, with a slightly charred component. Smokiness is an undercurrent, but noticeable. Great balance between acidity and bitterness. Slick and thin mouthfeel with a smooth finish.
Quite a light-coloured beer, as porters go (very red). Aroma is standard porter roast, toast, chocolate. Smoke is subtle, but provides some bite. Pretty dry.
Lis of punch. Toasty flavour. Very dark brown to black colour, with a little bit of an off-white head.
tap. Brown with small head. Smoked porter with some woodiness. Surprisingly more wood than smoke. Bitter hops in the finish. Dry.
I was just browsing the porter rankings and noticed I didnt have this rated, but Ive had it several times... Including about two weeks ago. This is a pointless rating, dont read it. Its good.

Bottle from Rehills of Jesmond.ppurs mahogany with a cream head. Peaty smoke aroma. The taste is smokey with spiciness and burnt toast notes. Nice, but not quite as amazing as Id hope for from Stone.

650ml bottle. pours a rather dark brownish black with thin, firm tanned head. aroma is dark malts, coffee, cocoa and dark fruits but no smoke. taste is smooth bitter cocoa and coffee with a malty finish. alas, no smoke either but still, a great porter.

650ml brown bottle. Medium amber colour, clear. Beige foam, creamy bead. Good lacing. Aromas of chocolate and light smoke. Roasty dark malt and coffee flavour with late entering smoke underneath, nice bitter malts in the finish. Body is a bit thin. Tasty.

I dont know if I got a bad batch or if my taste buds are a little flat today, but i remember this beer being more complex and more smokey the last time I had it. it tastes really bland for a stone beer. the smokiness is muted and it tastes a little watery. its still a good beer though with good chocolate and coffee notes
On tap piuttosto scura lievi note maltate legno un tocco affumicato discreto corpo amaro medio buona beva affumicato finale
Vom Fass, Schwarz im Glas, extreme Röstaromen in der Nase, frisch im Antrunk, die Röstaromen kommen wieder im Abgang. Hatte ein viel schwereres Bier erwartet, gut trinkbar
Nice dark amber color, pleasant smell but nothing overwhelming. Taste is more mild and drinkable than I expected. If youre looking for a Porter this is a good one.

22oz bottle. Pours a deep dark mahogany color with dark ruby highlights around the edges, topped by a super thick and creamy tan head that sustains and leaves excellent lacing. Aroma is roasted, dark malts, some dry cocoa powder, slight char, some leafy, ashy, and dry hop character. Taste is roasted, nearly burnt malts, dry, light cocoa, bitter slightly sweet coffee beans, and herbal hops. The smoke shows up in the finish and is more noticeable as the beer warms. Smooth medium body with moderate carbonation.
pint on tap, dark brown with creamy tan head that sticks to the glass. Smoked notes of peat, roasted coffee, and earthy. Long dry finish.
Bomber pours coffee-black w/a persistent tan head. Faint roast aroma, medium-bodied chocolate/coffee palate, ending with a roasty finish. Overall, a great porter at an even greater price.

650mL bottle Enjoy by 11/22/14
Deep, near-opaque, ruby body, holds a small but tight beige head.
Moderately intense aroma; roasted malt, charcoal smokiness, some dark chocolate & citrus hop character.
Medium bodied, smooth creamy body, moderate carbonation.
Roasted character continues on the body - burnt nutty, malty, charcoal, with light charred woody smoke, cocoa & dark chocolate, good measure of grassy, floral, citrus hop. Moderate bitterness, drying on the finish.
Pretty good. Not overly smokey, decently made porter.

Bottle from whole foods naples florida. Pours black with ruby red highlights. Large off white head. Aroma is light smoke, coffee chocolate, burnt malts. Flavour is burnt malts, coffee, lactose, chocolate with dry bitterring smoky finish. Medium carbonation. Medium body. A very nice porter.

Bottle. Pours ruby with a beige head. Aromas of chocolate, smoked malt and gypsum. Flavors are dark chocolate, a hint of coffee, nuttiness and bready notes. Finishes with dark fruits and charred toast. Light, peppery mouthfeel. Overall, a very nice, roasty toasty porter.

A nice smoky aroma drifts from the bottle as I pour into this porter glass, and the dark umber colored liquid is covered in seconds with a two finger, soft khaki head. The head is significant and certainly doesnt block the smoke scent coming from the glass. Very smoky, a nutty and an almost hidden toasted coffee bean foundation floods my taste buds, the medium body being a good catalyst for the flavors. The carbonation is nice, although it could be a bit more lively in my opinion, but lasts well throughout the glass. The finish is comfortable, lasting, and something that will be hard to follow; perhaps Im done reviewing for the evening. 
Not my favorite Stone, but definitely another score for that brewer.
"Big Porter, rich, full, and robust as Stone claims. The fairly subtle smokiness (especially when compared to Alaskans SP) adds an uncommon complexity. good stuff!"
On tap at craft. Clear brown. Aroma of wood, smoke, chocolate, coffee. Taste is sweet and bitter. Dry finish.

EBD 7/17/14. Clear dark amber pour (similar to Coke) with a nice garnet note. Normal head and retention very good lacing. Nice complex nose of chocolate, light roast with toffee/coffee notes, a very subtle hint of dark fruit and a light smoky character that becomes pronounced as it warms. Light medium bodied with an almost smooth texture. Good carbonation with a bit of effervescence on the finish and in the middle. The flavor profile is quite nice, balanced - with a smoky skew - and complex. It begins with roast, then fades into a light chocolate sweetness. The middle effervesces into a burst of smoke and light hops over a well balanced bitterness. As it flows into the finish, hints of dark fruit emerge. The finish leaves you with a nice smoky aftertaste that lingers over hints of dark chocolate.

Pours a dark black with tan head. Has a coffee, nut, malt, and chocolate aroma. Starts with a coffee and chocolate taste and continues with smoky flavors, malts, and coffee grounds. A very distinct smoky lingering aftertaste.
On draft. Aroma of chocolate covered raisins. No real smoke flavor or aroma. Instead some vanilla, cocoa and maybe some fig. Good beer, just not much rauch.

Very dark brown beer with small head. Aroma is roast malts. Taste is roasted malts, mild chocolate, some smoke and dark fruits. Medium bodied. Good beer.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bomber poured black with a big beige head that dissipates quickly. Very drinkable coffee toffee caramel hints but not sweet. Best part is if you nurse it and let it warm , the last bit has an almost scotch/peaty smoke taste to it. Very nice autumn beer....Just like all the brewerys selections.

Keg at the Rutland Arms; coca cola brown pour with a creamy tan head, aroma has a hint of smoke, taste has chocolate, peat, maybe some leather, not a massive amount of smoke but just enough for my likings.

Tap from notes. Nose and taste follow, Smoke, lots of soy, salt, licorice, touch of coffee, slight hazelnut int the back nine. Balanced lasting finish. 

High quality porter.
Keg Rutland arms Sheff. Black good tan head lace. Aroma is roasted smoke coffee taste is same some liquorice decent bitter finish. Bit thin body as per porter style. Good stuff.

Aroma: bacon, smokey, bread malts. Appearance: dark brown/black, hardly any head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: some smoked malts, sweetness, smoked and toasted flavours, getting slightly bitter in the average-long finish. Overall: very nice Smoked, great palate. Pint at Cask Pub & Kitchen.

on [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Berlin. faint aroma of smoke, stronger aromas of coffee, malt-coffee, a faint touch of toffee. well-balanced, very good drinkability, tastes only faintly of smoke, this being my first Stone I had expected a bit more concerning complexity of flavours, hm...

Bottle - 650ml. Pours a very dark brown body with a good beige foamy head. Nice, well balanced, complex malty/hoppy aroma with chocolate, coffeeish, roasted cereals, and some oaky hints. Its perfectly balanced malty/hoppy taste carries the same roasty, chocolate, and woody notes as the aroma. In addition some subtle anise hints are noticeable. Ends with a long bitter/roasty finish. Very well done.

1pt 6fl oz bottle served in a chalice. Dark, dark ruby with a thin beige head. Chocolate and coffee aroma with similar flavours, and some vanilla sweetness. Subtle rather than aggressive, the smokiness is quite subdued, the palate rich and smooth, the overall effect a seductive well balanced beer.
Bottle at a tasting. Pour is black with a small caramel head, aroma is sweet roast malt with light smokiness. Taste is smoky, rich maltiness, light coffee and a balanced finish. Very good
Smokey initial flavor with chocolate aftertaste, dry bite sort of pale. Gets better when warm and through most of the bottle

Pours a very dark brown with velvety, creamy beige head. Soft burnt wood aroma, some coffee, some peat. taste has some of the smoke flavor, some chocolate, lots of the dark roast grains. Still plenty bitter, but with a nice fireside feel.
Draft. Pours a dark brown. Aroma and taste are roasted malts and caramel with a slightly smokey finish.

Beautiful dark park w/ a great tan head that leaves excellent lacing! Very good smoke, chocolate, & slightly fruity aroma. The light mouthfeel is fantastic as its medium bodied but the smoke flavor is just a touch too much. Just a tiny bit more balance w/ the chocolate flavor would make this beer damn near perfect! The smoke is an interesting touch on the porter & overall this is a terrific brew!

650ml bottle. Pours a clear ruby-flashed black, with a smallish beige head, which lasts well and leaves good lacing. Black coffee and milk chocolate are the dominant aromas, with a little caramel sweetness and smoke in the mix as well. A brief initial milk chocolate flavour soon fades into herbal hops. Black coffee and dark chocolate in the mid-palate give way to a subtle blend of smokiness and sweetness akin to that of an Islay scotch in the finish. A very nice, subtly smoky porter.

A chestnut colored beer with just an average foam head that leaves a fair amount of lacing down the side. Aromas of rich malts and sutle hints of smokiness.
A nice tasting beer with rich complex malts over sutle background smokiness. Hints of coffee and espresso are present with an underlying hop bitterness.
Smooth full body beer creamy, but a little watery.
A nice well made beer.
Wedzony mocny w smaku. Kupiony za nieca?e 5 dolarów w soquel. Wedzonka zbilansowana. Warty spróbowania

Bottle with James K and Bert. Deep brown with a small tan head, although we were using Jamess nice bone porcelain mugs. The aroma is chocolatey, subtle smoke. A little more smoke in the flavour, lightly sweet chocolate and roast malt, ashy, tart smoky finish. Medium body. A really good porter.

A colablack beer with a big, dense and beige head. The nose has roastiness, dry smoke and coffee. After dominating elements there are also some dark bread, chocolate and herbs. Taste has smooht smoke, chocolate, some nice sweetness and bitterness, also coffee in the end. Medium bodied, mild carbonation, very smooth to drink. Good beer, the smoke is not too dominating, quite complex.

650ml bottle from Saveur Biere


Black colour with a small beige head. Aroma of coffee beans and some smoke. Flavour of coffee, roastiness, ashy notes. Mouth-feel is rich. I think that this porter doesnt need more ABV, this is fine just like this.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2015 Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: opaque dark black beer with small carbonation and small brown head. Smell: roasted malt and caramel and sugar cane. Taste: good malty taste and licorice. Aftertaste: good roasted malt with sugar and caramel. 
-----
On tap @ Stone Brewery, Escondido - CA. Color: dark black beer with small carbonation and small brown head. Smell: roasted malt and brown sugar. Sugar concentration with licorice notes. Taste: nice roasted malt and black bread. Caramel finish and licorice. Aftertaste: rostead malt and sugar finish.

Transfer from BA review on 5-23-12- 
Poured from 22 oz bomber into pint glass

Appearance  Pours a deep brown nearly black color with a thick one finger tan head. The head had very nice retention leaving a medium amount of lacing.

Smell  Roasted malt is heaviest in the nose. These are cocoa and dark bread in nature with lighter hints of some smokiness, pine and a nice caramel/brown sugar sweetness.

Taste  A smooth roasted malt and cocoa flavor mixed with a light sweet caramel start the taste out. The caramel fades as some hoppy flavors come to the tongue. These are largely earthy in nature with lighter flavors of pine. At the end, the smoke that is suggested in the name, comes to fruition along with a resurgence (light resurgence) of some sweeter flavors. 
Overall a very nice taste is left on the tongue in the end. 

Mouthfeel  Creamier then the average brew with a slightly lighter level of carbonation. Very nice for the roasty-smoky flavors of the brew.

Overall  Its a rather easy to drink, roasty and a good go to for a slightly dryer porter. Not too shabby.

Bottle. Pours clear very dark brown with a big mostly lasting creamy beige head that leaves great lacing. Aroma of hay and grass. Light to medium bitter and lightly sweet in a light body. Light smoky flavor mixed with dark malt and bitter hops. A bit too much carbonation and a long bitter finish.

Delicious, in a strong smokey beer kind of way.

On tap at the Sheffield Tap.

Pours a medium brown with a medium offwhite head that leaves good lacing (in a plastic cup at the Mondial, anyway). Nose is of smoke, smoke and more smoke. For sure there is some roasted malt in there but I cannot find it. Taste is moderately bitter, offers smoke and some burnt malt flavors. Never ashy or stout-y, this is a real porter. Body is medium, carbonation moderately high and finish of smoky wood. Overall a really good smoked beer!

Pours a dark ruby with nice amount of off white head. Smells smokey with hints of chocolate, vanilla, and coffee. The taste was really good. Vanilla upfront with peat smoke not dominating the whole beer. At the end chocolate, coffee, and some hops come through to balance everything out! Pretty light palate. One of my favorite porters I tried so far!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2014 Appearance: Poured a very dark brown, almost black color. Creamy tan head about two and a half fingers worth. This head left very nice lacing.

Aroma: Smoky with a little vanilla.

Taste: Smoked malt, vanilla, a hint of chocolate. Coffee flavor at the end. I think it has a very well balanced range of flavors.

Mouth feel: Seemed a bit thinner for what it looked like while pouring, but definitely not a bad mouth feel.

Serving type: on-tap
Another example of honesty in labelling by Stone. Mind you, itd be more accurate to call it "An excellent smoky porter" - because that is exactly what it is.

Everything about this porter is spot in for the style. The smoky flavor doesn't hit you when you first drink it but the aftertaste leaves a burning sensation in your throat. You know you just inhaled smoke.

Bottle, picked up somewhere in NYC. Dark almost black colour, ruddy hints, thick head. Very full flavour, actually uses the strong abv. Roasty malts, chocolate and coffee, restrained hint of smoke. Quite a hoppy finish, a bit less of this might have let the malts shine through more. Very drinkable and pleasant.
22 oz bottle poured a murky dark brown. Lots of head. Aroma of roasted coffee. The taste is bold roasted malt and coffee flavors with mild smoke with a long finish. Great!

Simply as good as they get! Not overpowering on the smoke in the aroma, but sausage, charcoal and burn is subtle underneath the smell of hoppy spruceness. Balanced carb on the tongue, smoke is obvious but very gentle. It does not spoil the beer. Incredibly well crafted smoked beer.

From bomber. 

"Stone", "Smoked", & "Porter"... Pretty descriptive name for this beer...

Stone - says this beer will have a good base.

Porter - Stone's Porter is that base

"Smoked" - this is a smoked porter. The smoke comes through stronger in the taste than in the aroma. 

Pretty good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at tribes alehouse. Pretty much what youd expect, nothing overwhelming. Strong vanilla aftertaste, slightly dry.... its ok

The smoke just covers it all. Its prety burnt good.... although kind impossible to have the whole 
bottle

Smells delicious, chocolate, rich malt and liquorice. Pours dark brown with a tan head, looks of low carbonation, 

Big bitter flavour up front, followed by dark berries, burnt malt, slightly smoky, a little bit of grapefruit. 

Heavy body and early bitterness, medium carbonation, dry finish. 

A unique beer which is worth trying and good enough for continual purchase. The smoke isn't to over powering and best for those who like hops. Not sweet and more refreshing than you would expect a porter to be.
Dark pour with a light beige head. Smokey aroma with coffee and chocolate. Roasted bitter hoppy taste with coffee finish. A nice beer

Dark chocolate, grape/raisin, a touch of coffee, nuts, and soft pine on the nose. Taste was sweet up front - almost like light orange meets coffee and caramel. Shifts into mix of caramel, dark chocolate, and smoke, then fades to earthy hop, grapefruit, pine, and burnt wood. A different flavor stands out with each sip. 

Palate was medium-thick bodied with nice, crisp carbonation. Smooth, lightly viscous, and drying. I wish all Porters felt like this one.

Stone is my favorite brewery for a reason. All four categories are brilliantly crafted and mix together to create one hell of a Porter here. Each sip shifts focus to somewhere else. The back of the bottle hits the nail on the head by saying, "Stone Smoked Porter is mysterious, smoky, and verging on utterly decadent".

1pt 6fl.oz ($4.99) First time trying anything from Stone. pretty good, like the flavor a lot. It really doesnt taste like anything else and is a great match with BBQ and grilled meats. I liked it and will buy again

Bottle from Bier Huis, Ossett. Theres no point adding a description. Its all been done. But what I will say is, Im drinking this with a smoked bacon sandwich, and the bacon is from Kempkas butchers in Sheffield. It is the best bacon youll eat. And the beers pretty good too...
Its very smoked. If you like eating smoked salmon, next to a smokey bonfire, whilst drinking porter, this is for you. I love it.

Dark brown, much lacing. 
Medium body, long palate, lingering. 
Very nice bittersweet balance. 
Light roast flavor. 
Enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours black with a small beige head. Aroma is malt, coffee, chocolate, smokiness and roastiness. Taste is light to medium sweet leading to a roasty and slightly smoky finish. Pretty good.

Really frothy off white head. Very dark colour. Surprisingly fizzy for a porter. Milky chocolatey aroma. Taste is somewhat lost amongst the fizz. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

At Cincy Airport. Pours a dark ice tea color - dark, but light for a porter. Somewhat light nose of roasted malts. Taste has some smokiness, malt, touch of coffee. It's somewhat simple for a porter, but it is still good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark brown with ring head and good lacing. Aroma is roasted malt, with a little smoke and hint of vanilla. Taste is heavy roast with some chocolate and smoke. Slightly meaty at times. Smoke is just an element, as advertised, but Im still not impressed with this or the style. Palate is thin.
On tap at global Brew. Pours a midnight black, with a sizable off white head. Sweet roasted malt and vanilla aroma. Smokey burnt malt flavor, with vanilla and coffee notes. Nummy num!

Świetne piwo! Aromat niezbyt intensywny, choć niezwykle przyjemny, nuty palonych słodów, czysty profil, choć pod koniec zaczęła się ujawniać cudna mleczna czekolada. W smaku dzieje się za to bardzo dużo. Jako pierwsza uderza potężna paloność, która na finiszu poparta jest równe potężną chmielową goryczką tworząc długi i intensywny posmak. Nuty wędzone są delikatne, kojarzące się z whisky, świetnie spajające się z palonością, gdzieś w tle suszone owoce. Bardzo dobra pijalność, pełnia wysoka jak na tak "cienkie" piwo.
Very smooth. Dark pour, thick head. Reminds me of Guinness. Tasty with only a hint of smokey roasted taste. Good beer.

Not a big Porter fan...at least not before I tasted this brew. This beer is a great example of a big time hop head converting a bit to the dark side. The smell was decent, but the taste, mouthfeel, and finish were very good. Now Im apt to try more Porters to stack up, and see how this one really MEASURES up! Keep on drinking...
Very good porter, not much smoke. Smooth almost milky when swallowed . Cant stop sipping long enough to type. I will be getting this one again...soon!

Much rather have the vanilla bean addition!! Not a bad brew, but the smokiness overtakes the porter taste! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a nice deep dark brown with a light milk chocolate colored head. I love the smokey flavor with the subtle hints of chocolate.
Smoke is mildly present, malt is balanced averagely with the chocolate. Coffee is also present, not overwhelming though.

smokey enough to satisfy my smoke craving. chocaletey with a hint of dark coffee, theres a lightness in here somewhere, but I have a tough time placing it...perhaps deep caremely? maybe its in the malt? full bodied, also slightly nutty. I didnt care for the "arrogant bastard" as much as the ratings on here would indicate, but I found this to be a very satisfying and complex brew.
UPDATED: FEB 26, 2014 Coffee, nuts, and a very faint hint of smoke. Not your average porter, almost tastes more like a brown ale to me. Still good though.

The smell is subdued; only a hint of the smokiness comes out in the aroma, followed by some coffee and chocolate, more of an alcohol scent than the ABV implies. The color is very dark brown, verging on black. Pours a thick brownish head that takes a while to go away. The taste is charcoal, salty bacon, but very light for the style. The mouthfeel is a little weak, but the carbonation is very light and like it is said of many mainstream beers, "it goes down easy". This beer would be great for a BBQ, or for anyone like myself who wants to drink dark beers, even in the summer. Great take on the style. Highly recommend.

Bottled. Pours deep brown with an average, lacing tan head. Aroma of slightly roasted malt, chocolate, coffee and a hint of smoke. Sweet flavor that ends up dry with bitter notes. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carb. An excellent porter inndeed.

Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. This is a very dark brown beer with ruby red highlights. It has chocolate and red fruity flavours, a smoked/roasted body and a spicy red fruit, citrus, chocolate, oak and zesty and fruity finish. Excellent!

Poured from a bottle. Dark red and barely translucent. Aroma of chocolate, metal, and a little smokey. Thick body. Roasted coffee, dark chocolate, wood chips. Has a bit of a hop kick. Honestly, it doesnt taste that smokey to me.

Nice brown head that quickly fades. Subtle aroma of smoke and dark fruit. 

Light body, nice subtle smokey flavor. Not overbearing. Finishes dry.

Keg in CBC Islington. Opaque black, off white head.Nose is smoked meaty frankfurter sausage, roasted malt, flinty minerally. Taste is smoked, wood charred, charcoal bitter. Not getting much of the porter. Slight roasted malt, minerally, bit of a hop kick. Its not in great condition to be honest and a lot of the flavours are masked.
Bottle pours dark reddish black with off white head. Nice lacing. Roast, light smoke, caramel, coffee. Moderate bitterness, light sweetness. Medium crisp body.

660ML Bottle; £8 so about 12 $ to my American homies ; I have wanted to try Stone smoked for years , so Im drinking it right now ; I expected more smoke for one thing ,its like an under-card or undercurant or some shit metaphor , either way any smoke texture is subtle or obscured . A big ass punch of rich roast and sticky alcoholic hops glides over my palate ... As I sip this shit lots of un-chill thoughts haunt my mind . Im stressed out and dissolutioned with everything since selling my business ... My life has no real meaning, ive gotta get out of this hick town and back home to London , only moved her for my business . This beer is soothing these issues a tad ... this is a good floral porter , not a Black IPA , not really smoked , but tight ass shit when im feeling like this ... great tangy bitter finish ,,chocoloate covered boozy grapefruit Keep it real .

From bomber to glass. Pours dark brown and slightly ruby in the light with a moderate but thick light tan mocha head. Wet, thin lacing. Aroma is sweet-roasted chocolate malt. Taste is rich smoke-roasted chocolate with a smoky roasted bitter hopped backend that lingers in fluidic ashen wisps. This beer gets better as you drink it. It's quite a bit like smoking a fine cigar. This is one great porter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Drought. Brown with reddish tint, beige spongy head, caramel aroma, low carbonation, smoked coffee taste, long finish with coffee aftertaste. Very good and balanced porter.
A bit of smoke, but not too much. Lots of chocolate and coffee, but there is a mild, smooth texture and light smoky acidity.
Draft. Black with thin tan head. Aroma of roasted malt and a hint of smoke. Medium body, roasted malt, chocolate and a slight smokiness with a bitter finish. Just the right about of smoke.

Draft pours dark brown with red hues and a thin white head. Aroma of caramel, dried fruit, and slight alcohol with no noticeable smoke on the nose. Taste is smokey, caramel, bitter hops, light fruit. Slightly bitter finish with a medium body. Finally a smoked beer I enjoyed!
Solid, as most things are from Stone. Dark pour. Thick body. Beautiful balance of dark fruits, coffee and charred malt. Smokiness comes through subtle woodchip flavors; no liquid smoke taste here!

Pours dark brown with a medium tan head. Has a sweet aroma. Taste is smoky with a bitter coffee twang. Has a nice chocolate kick at first but the after taste is like ash. Had high hopes for this but it was still good...just not great.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 15.01.2014, 0,65l bottle (bbd. 02.04.2012) sampled @ BBGTC tasting:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet, dark malts, caramel, licorice, lactose, chocolate, dark sugar, butterscotch. Taste is slightly dry and oxidized, dark malts, caramel, coffee, butterscotch, hay, chocolate, cardboard. Medium to longlasting bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Fair enough, has probably faded a lot.

A nice Smokey flavour and aroma nothing overpowering, great looking head and dark color, kinda leaves me thinking what else could be involved to help the character overall but nonetheless decent mix up beer

Pours dark brown with a creamy tan head. Moderate smokey aroma with a good malty backbone and roasty character. Taste is smoke and roast flanked by caramel and malts. Well balanced with a light bitter touch.
On tap at Pear. Pours a dark reddy brown color with a bit of head. Smokey roasted malt flavors. The smokiness balances well and doesn't overpower it.

Black with ruby highlights and a decent off-white head. Aroma of roast and coffee, primarily, as oppose to smoke, which comes out more as a "woodiness" than anything. Taste has a much more pronounced smoky feeling, along with roast, ash, coffee, and chocolate. Roast increases on palate, too. Im not a big fan of "smoked" beers, but this is quite nice.

From the tap out of my growler. Pours a near pitch black with a tan head. Smell of sweet chocolate and subtle coffee notes. Taste is very sweet and robust from the chocolate and smokiness. Great malt body that also gives it its sweet body. Good beer.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2014 
Format: Bottle from World Market, Redwood City ($3.99)
Appearance: Deep cherry black with milk chocolate headAroma: Initial smoke and wood. Later chocolate cereals.
Taste: Roasted malts, dark fruits, dry finish
Overall: A solid saturday morning but was hoping for a bit more campfire

Beautiful deep brown/red in color. Has a light head is tan, dissipates quickly leaving only small ring. Smokey, slightly bitter aroma. Very robust smokey taste. The dark chocolate/coffee malt is initial taste followed by a wonderfully balanced bitter, hoppy finish. Excellent porter.

2014/01/01 - Pours a clear, dark mahogany colour with a medium, creamy, khaki head that quickly reduces to a lasting surface film. Aroma is chocolate, smoke, molasses and dark fruits. Taste is sweet chocolate malts and dark fruits up front, with a roasted nuts and coffee base and smooth, smokey aftertaste. Mouthfeel is medium with smooth carbonation and a bitter, drying finish. A well executed porter.

black with a thin tan head. aroma is roasted malts coffee and chocolate. flavor is coffee, roast, chocolate, and bitter finish. medium carbonation.

A rich, dark brew. I've had better porters but that smoky aftertaste is admirable and should be tasted at least once

On tap at Fenton Fire Hall...awesome silky smooth black liquid with flavors of dark roast coffee, chocolate, and dark fruit all dancing about, but none taking the lead. Only problem was that there was little to no smoke which was disappointing.

text: Beige coloured head dark pour medium carbonation the aromas coffee dark chocolate caramel bacon the flavours peat coffee bean medium bitter rich chocolate caramel some bacon stone fruit resin touch the finish best tastes dark fruit sweet malt roasted taste smoke and bitter finish lovely for the style
22 oz bottle pours a dark black color with a nice off white head. Aromas of chocolate, coffee, hint of smoke. Medium bodied, rich, very good.

Poursa darkish brown color witha healthy head that fades slowly to nice lacing. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, roasted malt and a bit earthy. Taste follows suite with a nice blend of coffee and dark chocolate, with roasted malt and just a subtle bit of smoke in the background. Has a nice bitterness and a dry finish. Fairly full body, smotth, thick and a bit of a creamy texture. Very nicely balanced. This beer has a richness not found in a lot of porters. Well worth checking out.

a light/creamy smoked porter.
might not be "as smoked" as what you would get in Bamberg,but i have no complaints.

On tap at hills. 

A: pours a dark brown ale with a sigle finger of tan head. This falls over a few minutes to a thin quilt of the same. Excellent ruby clarity. spotty lacing. 

S: Nutty porter with a mesquite smokiness. Nice, subtle, simple. Nothing special. 

T: woody, nutty (pistachio actually). Midpalate, I get some cocoa and coffee. nice finish is smooth on the smoke. 

M: Medium body with lo carb. Semi dry finish is nice. Creamy feel. 

O: good smoked beer. I think the style is tough to get right and they did a good job here.

Serving type: on-tap

07-11-2011

Draft. Smells like a chocolate bar with a thin head that dissipates. Not as heavy as you would expect. Nice vanilla tones with dark chocolate flavors.

Pours dark with slight white head. Nose is nutty, with smoke, chocolate , coffee. Taste is smokier than the nose, little coffee bitterness, nutty, not sweet not getting the chocolate that i had on the nose. Rather dry, moderate carbonation. Very solid porter.

Bottle from local BewMo, Sunnyvale. Colour is dark brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Smoke, coffee, hints of chocolate and roasted malts.
Tap at stone brewing, escondido. Black color, light brown head. Aroma is very roasty and smoky. Medium body, roasty, little hoppy, some coffee.

This very dark porter is quite good. Hops are pronounced but not overwhelming. The malt flavor captures a subtle hint of the peat smoke and is rich in flavor. Medium to full in body. An excellent porter.
Bomber pour..porter/stout tasting..slight chocolate..slight bitterness..smoke is on the outskirts..decent..remember liking this more in previous years..

Too hoppy for me. Nice smokey aroma and initial taste. Finishes way too hoppy. Very thin mouth feel.

From a bomber. Dark brown with tan head. Inviting aroma of coffee and bread with a little smoke... Very tasty brew...

This is frequently one of my "go to" beers as usually the selection is mostly IPAs, lagers, and pale ales. Nice chocolate and coffee aroma with some roast and peat smoke. Bottle - pours pitch black with thick fine tan head. Nose of smoke, malt, and coffee. Incredibly smooth mouthfeel. Taste is of creamy chocolate with smokiness throughout. Bitter dry finish.
