Bottle sample at Stone tasting. Pours dark reddish-brown with a nice beige head. Aroma - roasted malts, coffee and chocolate. Taste - sweet, toasted malts, dark chocolate, smoky, tart notes, medium bitterness. Medium-bodied, medium carbonation, oily texture. Very nice.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours a dark brown with a tan head. Taste dark chocolate, roasted malt, coffee. I thought this was so so (I don't like coffee). I would not drink this again.

On tap at alewife in Baltimore. Pours dark brown. Smoke and roast malt. Smooth and creamy. Very nice beer.

TAP at Chez Moeder Lambic during "Moeder Lambic Vs. Stone".
Only found back scores, not ratings.
This porter has a bitter burnt aroma with a smoked malt flavor, accompanied by small bursts of hops. The color is dark brownish black and has excellent lacing.
Mahogany color with a foamy off-white head. A nice combination of smoky flavor and light bitterness. Goes down smooth and tastes delicious.
Nutty vanilla and dark malt aroma. Dark brown color with a pillowy off white head. The smokiness starts off followed by caramel and nut aftertaste. Incredibly balanced.

Strong bitter start for porter. Pours dark as most porters, foaming tan head. Reminds me of copenhagan snuff that almost turns me away, nice carbonation for a porter. Smokiness a bit overwhelming. Porters are my brew, but this is not my favorite, although its quality.

Pint bottle, poured into a traditional mug. Aroma of coffee and chocolate. Poured solid black. Nice light tan head, wavy lacing, and even thick geographic lacing that caked the inner walls of my mug, something I have never seen before. Noticed the smokyness at the nose, and strong flavors of dark chocolate, coffee just a twinge of a rasberry. Awesomely a nice blend of hop bitterness with malt sweetness, could not get over the smokyness. A medium or heavier mouth feel. Overall I was very impressed with this superbly executed porter.

Had a pint on tap at World of Beer Columbus. Very nice. The smoke is somewhat subtle. Creamy, delicious.

On the train from Hereford to Inverness, bottle from BOE, 18/10/13.
Faded black with a good sized light tan frothed up head.

text: Flaska @ Pizzeria Paradiso, Dupont Circle, Wash. DC. Hälls upp svart med medelstort långvarigt moccafärgat skum. Dofter av lakrits, kaffe, chilli och rökighet, som är ytterst subtil. Smakerna är så många, så intensiva men ändå så välavvägda att det nästintill är omöjligt att hitta dem alla, men lakrits, kaffe, aska, röda bär och mörk choklad vandrar lätt och ledigt över smaklökarna. I eftersmaken dyker en chillihetta upp. Mycket fyllig kropp. Som jag njöt av den här ölen!

Bomber into snifter glass, deep dark brown with tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, light coffee and lighter smoke. Taste brings out more chocolate, caramel, ash, roast coffee with minimal earthy hop note. Medium body, low carbonation, slick with roasty smoke finish. Smoke does enhance the porter nicely, very good.

22oz bottle picked up at Total Beverage in CO 
Appearance: Pours dark brown with a medium sized tan head and some lacing 
Aroma: Roasted malts, smoky and roasted coffee 
Taste: Rich chocolate, ashy, smoky, roast coffee with a bitter finish 
Nice and tasty.

Burnt coffee, and toast smells. Woody hops, little bit of smokiness. Fairly light aroma. Pours a very nice dark brown with red tinges. Tan head with minor lacing. Very bitter on the tongue, with a little bit of caramelly sweetness. Clean on the palette, doesnt leave any nasty residues or feelings. Leaves your mouth feeling refreshed.

A rich, thick, chewy porter with tons of flavors competing for attention. The smokiness is subtle but discernible. Texturally, the beer is a bit sticky. Also, using this in a beer batter is on of the best ways out there to delicious-up onion rings...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

for all of the [ B.S ] on the back of the bottle ,, I was expecting better,, lots of bitterness no smoke!!!!! coffee, nuts, chocolate, caramel, roasty, resin, leather, licorice, very bitter, full body, slick feel, average carbonation,
From 22oz bottle to shaker. Pour is nearly black, very thick khaki head. Nose is rich malt, coffee, dark chocolate, molasses, oat. Taste is medium bodied, mostly sour with sweet notes. Very smooth.
One of my favorite porters. And at $3.99 a bomber it is fantastic. This could definitely be an often buy.

22oz bomber. Pours a dark brown/almost black color with a thin creamy tan head. Aroma of caramel, big chocolate notes, earth, and faint smoke. Taste of burnt toast, chocolate, smoked malt, and a piney/earthy lingering bitter finish.

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2014 Draft at Strangelove?s. Brown pour with a large foamy tan head. Runny lace. Rich, dark roast flavors. Good amount of smoke. Burnt peanut shells. Coffee grounds. Chocolate nibs. Black walnuts. Charcoal grill. Peppercorns. Lingering smoke in the finish. Pretty big notes for a Porter. Good stuff.

Pours dark brown with amber/ copper highlights. Aroma is roasted malt, wood smoke, citrus hop, faint chocolate, somewhat burnt. Aroma is very hoppy for the style. Flavor is a smoked, malty, hopped up, slight chocolatey little slice of heaven. Medium on the palate. Great beer.
I am not going to go through the snob bullshit. Drink this if you have the chance. A bloody steak and some friends all good.

Bottle after the enjoy by date. Brown body with nice tan lasting head, Aroma is some malt some coffee with an hint of smoke, taste is malt, chocolate and a hint of smoke aftertaste is bitter with a little bit of smoke. Nice beer more of a session porter with an hint of smoke . Liked it

Bottle @ home. Clear very dark brown, small off white head, nice lacing. Aroma, roasted malts, very clear smoke notes, chocolate, .Taste, roasted malts, smoke, licorice, chocolate, . Really nice porter. Dry roasted bitter aftertaste, with a clear smoke taste. Nice carbonation.
Smells like smoked sausage....not just smoke. Sips dry and full with a hint of sweet. Finish is what makes this brew and the smokinness shine. True porter roasty smooth flavors.

brown, moderate tan head with long retention and a lot of lacing. chocolate, roast, dark fruits, lots of smoke, ash, burnt wood. medium heavy bitter, light sweet. excessively bitter for the style, honestly. medium body, slick feel.
Chocolate aroma, taste of malt and smoke with a watery feel. Nice smokey finish on the palate.
Poured from a tap. Dark brown color, full white head. Slight roasted malt smells. A slight watery roasted malt flavor.

One of my faves, but I'm going to rate it anyway.. Pours black, no transparency when held up to the light. Brown colored head. Rich smell of darkly roasted malts. Fairly thick & robust palate. Definite smoke, quick dry dark chocolate, and finely balanced alcohol %. Finishes with the classic Stone hop/malt taste that runs in most of their flagship beers.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A excellent Smoked porter. Smokey flavor at beginning, then the familiar porter flavors, then back to a smokey aftertaste. Smokey flavor is not over the top.
Bottle. Color black with tiny brown head. Aroma malt, chocolate, coffee, roasted. Taste sweet, sour, chocolate, light smoke.

650ml from Good Spirits Co, Glasgow (£6.50):
Chocolate & dark malts initially with a definite smoked aroma on top that is luckily not as strong as I was expecting. There is some roasted notes and a few hops with some coffee.

Dark brown with a 1cm, bubbly head that is off-white to brown and settles as a nice lacing across the top with some build up around the sides with some nice lacing left on the glass.

Sweet & hoppy malts to begin with some touches of chocolate and a slightly smoked taste. Coffee & a bit of bitterness with some peat and roasted malts following this. A very well balanced beer with a nice combination of sweetness and roasted malts with the smoky character the name suggests with some chocolate at the end and some hops too.

Smooth with a medium body and nice balance to go along with the medium carbonation. A slightly rich tasting beer but one that goes down well.

A nice beer and one that was incredibly easy to drink with a great balance and a nice mix of flavours coming together well and keeping things interesting throughout.
Very peaty and smokey smell and flavor. Would go well with barbecue. A "meaty" brew with toasty notes and nice thick body.

Shared with David A
Appearance: Very dark brown, basically black. OK amount of tan head.
Aroma: Very dark malt, smoke.
Taste: More dark malt, some smoke, also coffee.
Info: 650ml bottle, 20/8-2013
September 2011. 22 oz. bottle. Pours almost black with a tan head. Aromas of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate and a hint of smoke. Awesome porter.
I love this stuff. Not very smoky but Im never disappointed when I open a bottle.

The aroma is of chocolate and hints of caramel. There is also roasted aroma and maybe a hint of coffee. It is dark brown with very little light coming through. The head is medium thick brown and dissipates very slowly. It has an extremely smooth, rich chocolate taste with a bit of bitterness.

Bottle picked up at Wholefoods last week. Thin brown pour to form a mostly opaque beer with a big expanding head. Looks decent. Not much going on in the smell at all. A little sweet, and thats the only generic response I can give to the smell. Taste is a little ashy, slight yeast, smoke is very mild but it builds. The watery taste and texture make it very drinkable - its disappearing quickly. But its not very exciting. Actually, its a little boring and I was expecting my tastebuds to get more of a workout. Average to below-average porter. If I took the high price into account, this would score less than 3.

Light malt aroma; deep amber appearance; malty with a light smoke taste; lightly fizzy on the palate with a quick finish; overall, a solid porter but not enough smoke or peat to live up to the name 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22 ounce bottle. Pours a translucent reddish brown color topped by a medium-sized rocky tan head. Subtle roasted malt aroma has obvious notes of smoke and cocoa. Flavor is roasted malt with hints of espresso and bittersweet chocolate. The smokiness is their, albeit very faint. The finish is bittersweet with spicy hops that lingers long on the palate.
UPDATED: FEB 26, 2014 Fantastic! Love this stuff it?s a personal favorite with a subtle smoked flavour and smooth taste
Bottle. Aroma is smoked cheese, creaminess, maybe vanilla. Bit fruity, chocolate. Taste is good, lightly fruity, lots of roast, some cream, only a hint of smoke at the end. Pretty nice. Spiky.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown, almost black with tan head. Aroma of coffee, smoke, and roasted malts. Flavor is roasty and bitter, with a bit of smokiness. Pretty good, but this is not my favorite style.

Another disappointing brew by Stone. It has a light head, dark to the color. A smooth pour. Chocolaty, coffee notes. Dry wash down. Too simplistic for my taste. In my opinion a porter should swing a bit. But for a Stone, well frankly this unacceptable!
Pours a dark brown, nearly black, with a foamy tan head. Aromas of smoke, toasted malt, chocolate, and some vanilla. Flavor is smokey, sweet and toasted malt with hints of chocolate and coffee.

Dark brown, almost black body, tan head. Aroma is smoke upfront, although not too much. A lot of malt and not so much hops. Flavor is great roasted malt and smokiness. Surprisingly not a lot of hops or IBUs for Stone. Great with bbq.

Pours very dark with a thick brown head. Just a hint of smoke and chocolate. Not smokey at all. The chocolate lingers on the tongue after swallowing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy
Nice aroma with color and head. Smokiness is almost nonexistent. Finish is a little earthy at times.
Outstanding example of a smoked beer, not as intense as a Aecht Schlenkeria Rauchbier and very tasty
On draught. Almost black brown color. Aroma of a smoked dark chocolate bar. Taste is similar to the aroma, but a little bit sweeter and with a coffee note.

Pours a dark ruby-cola brown with a stubborn, bumpy root beer head. Mild smoky aroma with just a hint of peat. Once the beer settles a bit, sweet lactose emerges. Medium-bodied, slick outside, but a little scrubby inside, and a bit thin. Flavors of dark roasted malt, smoke, and lactose. Nothing remarkable about the flavor. Just a solid porter.

Appearance is black with a small off white head. No translucency to background light. Aroma is slight smoke beyond a toffee, caramel, and coffee notes with a deep roasted malt. There is a slight yeast scent and sourdough scent. Taste is mildly smoky behind toffee, chocolate and coffee flavors. Also a slight bread or biscuit flavor comes through. Palate is medium but not watery with a slight fizz of carbonation on the tongue. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deep ruby red, practically black, with a decent size beige head. Aroma is very smokey, roast malt, some coffee, spicy, floral hops. Taste is light sweet, bitter with a medium duration. The texture is oily, a bit lighter than I was expecting, but a pretty nice beer.

Bottle. Pours very dark browny red with a tan head. Smells good but not too strong actually - roasty coffee, choc, treacle, licorice and some funkiness too. Its lovely - fairly light and smooth malty, choc, coffee some licorice and treacle, coke, some dark fruit at the and a hint of smokiness. The finish is very pleasantly bitter. Good.
Pairs very well with barbeque. Finished a little strong for my taste, but a very good porter.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with white head. Aroma of hops and slight citrus. Tastes of intense hops

The beer pours a very dark (almost black) color with a cream color head, that  never quite fades away. To begin the smells of malts, a bit of coffee and chocolate reign over the beer and the taste is pretty similar with a light smoky flavor to it as well. Overall a damn good beer for the price/

Pours black with ruby highlights and a rocky khaki head that leaves some thick lacing. Nose involves some mild roasted notes, mild smoke, light chocolate, with a fresh earthy hoppiness to support. Nice balanced sweet and bitter flavors. Medium bodied, softer side of active carb, with a full roasted, smoky, dry and toasty finish. Enjoyable brew, surprisingly subtle, well put together, and tasty.

Bottle, thnx to Stakem, Cheers!! Pours a very dark, almost black beer with a medium sized, beige head on top. Aroma is of chocolate, light smoke and roasted malts. Not like a typical smoked beer, much more subtle. Flavour is medium sweet, with touches of chocolate and vanilla. Light smokey, leathery finish. I really like the way how the smoke is being present in the background, making the body more full than a regular porter. Low abv, yet full flavoured and yet easy drinkable. Very nice beer!

Pours a deep dark brown color with aroma of coffee.  Taste is slightly smoked, with rich coffee flavor.  The smoke flavor is slight but rich enough tocome through the entire beer.  Im not a fan of smoked beer but this one was enjoyable.
Pours black like chocolate with rich roasted notes of coffee and toffee. Lots of sweet bitter taste with a huge smokey finish. Overall an amazing beer

Bottle. Black in color, khaki head, smoke/coffee aroma, ash or burnt wood in taste and across the palate, with the ash feeling through the finish. Its a pretty well balanced experience with a dry Smokey feeling all the way through.
22 oz bottle pours black with a tan head.  Aroma of smoke, roasted malt and coffee.  Taste is malts, smoky and chocolate.
Dark brown porter with nice off white head. Smell is wonderful smokey malt on the nose with a roasty malts taste with a burnt finish. A true delight! 99

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2013 Moderate aggressive pour.  Huge head of coffee/mocha brown.  Very nice lacing.  Jet black beer.  Arome is full of light smoke notes and some malts and yeast.  Smoke balances well with yeast and malt which is apparent on the finish of the nose.  Moderate body on palate, but expected a bigger body for a porter.  Hop character overpowers on mid sip.  Also bitters overpower on the finish.  Carbonation on tongue offers unplesant bitter character.  Hints of malt and yeast on initial sip, but quickly replaced with bitter hop taste.  Very little smoke character noticeable throughout the tasting.  Also very slight smoke flavor essence near the finish.  Wouldja - No.

Very light porter. Texture is watery with soft carbonation. Burnt malt in aroma, but its pretty watered down. Pours dark brown with good head and lacing. Finishes a little bitter. On tap at Blue Monk.

A - Thick root beer tan head shows great retention. Dark brown almost black body with chestnut edges.

S - Roasted malt, hints of beef jerky or bacon, cocoa, hazlenut.

T - Bitter dark chocolate, almond oil, toasted/burnt pumpernickel bread, pine hops and smoke on the sides and back of the tongue and last throughout the finish. Pine on the aftertaste.

M - Medium body, low carbonation.

Great balance of sweet smoky. The smoke is not overdone and compliment the beer well. Very nice finish and plenty of flavor.

Serving type: bottle

10-18-2011
Draft at cruncys. Not my favorite porter because Im not crazy about an all smoke aroma and taste.
Draft at Stone tap takeover at Crunchy's. Smells like smoke...Tastes like - malt, chocolate and, wait for it, a ton of smoke.

Light aroma of coffee, cocoa, and a slight bit of peat.  Good head with tiny bubbles that leaves only an upper ring of lacing.  Flavors are coffee and some cocoa; not much peat.  Light bitterness in the final stage that lingers well in the aftertaste.  Light to medium body.  Good - not great - porter.
Chinook/ Columbus dry hopping makes it quite hoppy for a porter, smokiness isnt that prominent, i expected more caramel-toffee profile, a bit sour too.

I swim against the tide then, I got more fruit than vanilla or smoke, but the fruit could be the vanilla in some fashion or other.

I little rough around the edges and not really delivering me what I thought I was getting from reading the bottle.

Its not unpleasant, its just not my cup of tea (or glass of beer)

Pours black as black can be, beautiful white creamy head, great head retention. Chocolate mostly on the nose, but hints of smokiness and berry. Taste includes lots of chocolate, some coffee, with a little smoke. One of the better porters I have ever had, excellent.
On tap, pours black with a white head.  Aroma is smoke, chocolate. Taste is smokey as well, with roasty flavors of chocolate and coffee.  Enjoyable.

Bouteille 22oz, courtoisie de Hogtownharry ou Blankboy. De couleur brune-noire et opaque. Nez de malt rôti, de chocolat noir, léger de café et de malt fumé (fumée de bois) avec des notes de mélasse et de houblon herbeux. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture moyennement huileuse et légèrement crémeuse. Goût légèrement fumé (fumée de bois, notes de tourbe) avec des notes de mélasse lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût moyen-léger amer de malt rôti, moyen de chocolat noir et de café doux puis en finale, lon retrouve un goût légèrement plus amer et sec de houblon herbeux aux notes résineuses avec un goût de café légèrement plus présent. Post-goût long aux notes sèches, moyennement amer de rôti, léger de café, de houblon et de rôti avec des notes fumées et de chocolat noir. (2006)

Bottle to flute, aged only a few months.
Blackberry, spice, grapes and sweet molasses. Black with a long lasting bubbly tan head. Taste has some nutmeg, sweet fruit, and brandy.

Bottle - Bitter chocolate, peat, berries and alcohol.  Jet black with a huge foamy off white head.  Chocolate, slight bitterness and of course the smoke with the berries in there as well.  There is a backend sweetness that is subtle and balanced.  I love smoked beers and this one although milder with the peat is pretty amazing.

Bouteille achetée au Vermont de 660ml partagée avec Patrick. Bière brune avec des reflets rouges qui a une mousse de couleur beige. Le nez est frais, les effluves discrets de chocolat fumé et de caramel sont intéressants. La bouche est trop facile, elle se boit tout seule. Cest frais. La texture est moyenne légère. Cest un porter très agréable. Le côté fumé est discret ce qui facilite la digestibilité de cette bière. Des petites notes de café en final agrémentent le tout.

Une grosse bouteille partagée avec rodenbach99.  Des parfums subtils de fumée qui vont et qui viennent à travers des malts chocolatés, caramélisés et justement torréfiés.  Des saveurs de café et de caramel avec des signes chocolatés.  Une fumée qui nest jamais au-devant des choses maltées.  Un corps qui nest pas lourd avec son pétillement juste et équitable.  Une texture huileuse et bien agréable.  Une finale amère de grains foncés qui reste courte et bien propre.  Une bière qui a fière allure, professionnellement exécutée, simple et très facile à boire.

It pours almost opaque black with ruby highlights; the head is beige and mousse-like. The aroma has notes of: dark chocolate, coffee, blackberry, and toast. The taste is light tart that finishes medium bitter; there are notes of: chocolate, coffee, dark berries, and charcoal. The palate is medium-light bodied, has medium carbonation, slight sticky, and a medium finish. Overall, its oddly un-smoked in profile for a "smoked" porter.
very dark with creamy off white head. being my first portet i would compare it to a stout being smilet with the toasted malt. more aromatic and piney hops.

Pours a nice dark amber with a tan creamy head has a nice smokey background. One of my fav porters

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours black with a one inch tan head. Rich malty smell with hints of chocolate and some hops. Roasted malt and some chocolate taste with smokey slightly bitter finish. Medium body and some carbonation comes through. Good smoked porter.
Deep dark brown pour with slight tan head. Aroma is smoky malt. Taste is smoky malt with a mild bitter dark chocolate.

Had in a 22oz bottle at Monks Pub in downtown Chicago. Pours super thick, creamy tan head with great retention. Almost black, with aromas of chicory, campfire, peat, etc. Has some cocoa on the mouth, but left me wanting more of a smoke flavor and not just smell. Enjoyed but could have been better.
Keg at Euston Tap, 13th March 2013.  Good smoked porter, not worthy of the price tag in London though.  Still enjoyable and tasty
Nästan svart öl med ett kraftfullt ljusbrunt skum. Doft av kaffe choklad och lakrits. Inte så stor rökighet. Samma tendenser i smaken. Gräddig munkänsla.

On tap 4 oz. pour at Westover Beer Garden &Haus in Arlington, VA. Clear, nearly opaque, densely dark mahogany-burgundy with khaki head and excellent lacing. Aroma of dark smokey malt, sweet cocoa, coffee and rare steak. (Im not sure where the meat aroma is coming from. Maybe it is an associate memory triggered by the mild smokiness.) Taste of dark smokey malt, sweet cocoa, coffee and pine. Medium/full body and medium/low carbonation. While the smokiness is very much a part of the texture of this beer, it blends with and enhances other elements rather than overpowering them. Very nicely done. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2014 Pours almost jet black, decent foamy head, nice light bubbly carbonation leaving a lacing. Roasted malt, caramel and chocolate, coffee and vanilla, less smokiness than the name would suggest. Palate is rich full and creamy, yet light and dry on the finish. Very nice.
Smells smoky.  No head.  Thick.  Tastes like liquid smoke.  Dark with some red.  Needs to be eaten with cheese...I dont have any so Im eating bison bacon.

Bottle (22 oz). Dark brown with a medium creamy beige head and good lacing. Aroma isnt overpowering with smoked malt, roasted malt and chocolate. Taste is moderately sweet with just the right amount of peated and roasted malt. Chocolate notes. Subtle bitter finish. Medium body, a tad watery. Very good balance. Extremely drinkable. Its the kind of Porter I really enjoy!

Deep brown, thin mocha coloured head. Aroma: light wood smoke, cocoa, roasted malts. Taste: wood/bbq smoke, dark chocolate, bitter espresso, American hops, slighty woody. Finishes dry and bitter, with a hint of cigrarette smoke. Slightly watery palate, medium carbonation. Balanced and flavourful.

A deep mahogany brown with two fingers of lingering, lacing head. Coffee and chocolate notes quickly give way to bbq smoke aromas. Taste of smokey chocolate with a bitter tweak towards the end. Full and rich on the palate, with appropriate carbonation levels. Lingering smoke and slightly bitter notes.

Bottle. Pours a dark opaque brown with two fingers tan/light brown head. Settles to thick pillowy cap in minutes. Aroma is mildly smoky, dark malt and roasted malt, definite chocolate, bitter. Flavor is mildly smoky and roasted with significant bitterness. Mildly roasty and chocolate finish with a bitter, mildly fruity finish. Soft carbonation, medium body, and smooth texture. A high quality beer but I am a little dissapointed with the flavor, they should have upped the smokiness or at least toned down the bitter a little.

Nice brownish-black pour with a one inch, thick and foamy head. Aroma is coffee, roasted malt and just enough smoke. Flavor is nice, with similar characteristics as the aroma, but with a hint of dark, bitter-sweet chocolate.  Finish is a bit oily for my palate, but not too bad for the style. Another good beer from Stone.
Bomber->snifter.  Pours like cola, dark brown with faint tan head.  Aroma is roasted malt, smoke, and chocolate.  Flavor is more smoky malt, coffee, and chocolate.  Very good.
Dark chocolate colour. white off tan head. Tastes of coffee, chocolate, and a roasty finish. A beer Boo Radley would probably drink.

Keg @ Stormbird. The pours deep brown with a tiny tan head. The aromas rich smoked wood, mineral, some umami aromas (steak sauce, maybe?). The taste is smoky chocolate, polished wood. Hints of licorice, general savory flavors. Pretty light and easy to drink. Overall, not bad stuff.

Bottle on mult occasion, pours deep brown, nearly black. Nice medium sized head with light brown lacing. Aromas and taste of smoke, roasty malts, coffee, chocolate, fig. This porter had a super rich texture to it. Warmed me the hell up on a freezing night. Cheers

Bottle. Poured black with a big light khaki head. Aroma was a lot of milk chocolate and roasted malt. Taste is largely the same but adds a subtle smokey note in the finish. Palate was smooth with a lively carb. Well made subtle beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a translucent dark brown with a large off white head leaving nice sticky lace up the glass. Aromas of roasted malts, grainy, bready, chocolate, lightly peaty and coffee. Flavour is roasted malt, lightly burnt, dark malt dryness, coffee bitterness and a medium bitterness.

Pours a clear medium brown with a reddish tinge.  Aroma of chocolate, coffee, some burnt roasted malts, and a slight peaty aroma.  Taste is lightly burnt roasted malts, chocolate and coffee.  Leaves a lingering bitterness on the finish which is dry. Medium-full body with a medium carbonation makes the roast malts and coffee flavors really stand out in this beer. Overall its a really nice robust porter but a bit too harsh on the burnt roast flavors.

650ml bottle from Cotteridge Wines.Amber black pour with a creamy medium sized head.Aromas of roast malt,smoke and some coffee.Dry roast malt taste with some coffee in there and a little background chocolate with the smokiness throughout but in a more subtle way than others of this style.Tasty beer.
On tap at baitshop..black pour..  aroms is wretched.. like a bandaid..eww..taste however is pretty similar..bandaid taste..just ok

First smell awesome , smokey. Second smell.... Band aid..... Damn it I hate when that happens. Killed the rating 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On draught at Uva Bar in Downtown Disney. Dark brown/black with a good sized beige head that leaves some good lacing. Aroma is chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, hint of smoke. Creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied, some hoppy bitterness on the finish. Taste is chicory, smoke, dark chocolate, grass, roasty grain.
Good tasting beer, but not to have frequently. At least i cant. Roasty, smoke with that common hop profile.

Pours jet black with a thick tan head that quickly dissipates. Smell of smoke but not overwhelming. Tastes of coffee and smoke, with a crisp finish. Very good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is the "plain" version...good on its own.. but chipotle was best...good tasty flavor and smooth

Smells like a campfire. Really nice dark beer with smokey BBQ-like flavors mixed with chocolate and coffee. It immediately feels like it's going to be harsh going down, but it's actually really smooth and has a great smokey finish. One of my favorites

The beer is dark brown with crimson highlights visible when held to the light. The beige head is an inch thick, displaying lasting retention with plenty of sticky lacing left behind. 

The aroma brings smoke, roast, brown bread, a touch of resinous hops.

Nice flavor with a forward smoke character. A touch of campfire and charred roast. Additional notes of salami, summer sausage. The finish offers a touch of bitterness with lingering pine and resinous hops. Quite flavorful and enjoyable.

Medium bodied and pretty smooth sailing with moderate carbonation. Alcohol content feels low and unobtrusive.

A solid beer. As easy as this one is to find, I definitely see myself buying this again.
Great dark dark color, almost black with creamy head.  Aroma of thick malts with plenty of smoke and it tastes just like it smells.  Great beer as usual from Stone.

It pours a deep dark black yielding a spectacular one inch white foamy head leaving some nice lumpy valleys in the head. The head dies within a minute. The smell is a roasty, dry coffee sort of thing going on with a nice amount of hops allocated inside of some light cocoa. The taste is dry, roasty, bitter and sweet at different times throughout the beer. Some burnt malts seem to come through a bit as the beer warms. The palate is medium to heavy coating my mouth and tongue nicely like it should on a cold winters night. Sharpness is slightly there. Overall, I liked it for the most part and would come back to it.

Tap - fair sized foamy head, almost black color, fair sized smoked malt aroma and flavor, not too overpowering though, should go good with the BBQ I just ordered

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: FEB 2, 2014 Ar-coffee, dark chocolate.  Ap-dark black,medium head. Ta-pepper added to the descriptors from the aroma.   Very nice, smooth porter.  Upping this beer a tad. ..loved it today.
This is such a classic beer! The smokeyness of this brew is astounding! Really balanced and pleasant!

Smelled like a loaf of white bread.
Poured it into a snifter: dark red, almost black; foamy tan head dissipates quickly leaving sparse lacing.
Tastes rich and bold, medium sweetness with bitterness back that goes away quickly leaving a malty taste that lingers long.
Lively carbonation on the tongue, medium mouthfeel.
Nice beer. Id drink it again.

Appearance: black, smallest hints of brown at the edges, thick and dense head, head is a dark tan color Aroma: coffee, chocolate, Taste: chocolate, hint of bitterness at the end Palate: heavy, leaves a slightly bitter coffee aftertaste, Overall: a bit too chocolate for my tastes, if you like chocolate or coffee a lot you will like this beer, I dont like coffee so I struggle to finish this ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours dark brownish black with low foam. Smell is light smoke and malt. Taste is roasted malt, nice smoke that fades. Great beer.
From a 22 oz bottle shared at home.  Pours a dark cola color with a tan head..Also cola in the nose.  Some hints of chocolate in a light porter body,  Very crisp and refreshing finish.

The beer pours a dark brown with a minimal tan head, and the aroma is smoky. It is quite bitter but very hearty at the same time, and the full body, slick texture, soft carbonation, and long bitter after taste make for an interesting and out-of-the-ordinary porter.

Smoky slightly hoppy and bitter. Not bad but wouldn't go looking for it. .........................,,.,

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Got this beer at the tobacco shop in Savannah so freshness is questionable.  Dark brown with frothy tan head that settles and stays with great lacing.  Smells smoky and like dark coffee.  Has some of the coffee/chocolate of a porter but I get mainly smoke which I don't like very much.  Full mouthfeel that is good for style.  Don't think I like smoked beers.  Consumed at Vernon's poker night 9-8-12.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bacon flavor!  Poured from bomber into maudite glass. Brown head on black pour. Does have a smokey flavor to it but it isn't overwhelming.  Very easy drinking.  Great beer

UPDATED: APR 16, 2013 #300 - Smokey malty aroma. Tastes of raisins and sweetness. Pours black with a quickly dissipating big tan head. Not my favorite Stone. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours black. White lacey head. Aroma is faint smoke. Taste is smokey bitterness, followed by faint sweetness. Crisp. Easy drinking. Nice but not outstanding.
Pours a very dark amber almost black, love the smokey aroma. Woody, chocolate and roasted wheat flavors, the smoke does not overpower.

Pours a dark brown with reddish hues. Lots of lacing on the glass. Smells like roasted malts and smoked wood. Taste is a solid porter base with quite a bit of smoke. Some sweet malts and dark roasted coffee with hints of chocolate. A pleasant hop bitterness on the finish. Light/medium bodied with good carbonation. Much lighter than I expected. Overall this was an enjoyable porter.  This would have been a great beer to enjoy with a nice cigar.

Pours from the bottle with a deep, nearly opaque black/brown color and generates a foamy sand-colored head. The aroma is disappointingly subtle, with only a bit of milk chocolate and weak coffee being discerned. The flavor is more what I had hoped for, with some soft, woody smoke, chocolate, and a bit of spicy, herbal hops for balance. The mouthfeel detracts from the varied flavor profile, with a fine, fizzy carbonation that borders on unpleasant. Overall, this is a fine porter with a bit of extra character, but it is is sadly subtle.

Poured into a goblet yields a good two finger mocha head that dissipates quickly. Opaque black in color and scent is mostly chocolate and coffee with slight smoke. Taste pretty much follows with a little woody smoke. Another solid offering from Stone.

Its got an assortment of Smoke, Chocolate, Coffee, Burnt Malt, Ham and Barley Flavors. The smokey taste is a bit too......smokey for my likings. Its a decent beer overall, but not my first choice when it comes to Porters or Smoked Ales
A little blander than I expected. Maybe Ive just had a lot of smokier smoked porters lately. I wouldnt say no to one, but not my first choice.
A bomber at home. Toasty, oaky aroma. Beautiful dark mocha color, caramel head, wispy lacing. Taste is light porter goodness. Carb level just right.  Nutty aftertaste. Enjoyed.

Just an average porter. Very disappointed with stone on this offering.  There are many others I would try ahead o this one 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

There is a lot to appreciate in this nicely priced Porter. Great earthy aromatics on the nose and the first sip was instantly smokey with big mouth-feel but, not sticky. Finish is still malt-forward with a nod to some mild  hop dryness. Great iteration of the style!
Bottle and Draught.  This is one of my favorites.  The smokiness is subtle and sits well over the complex balance of hops and roasted malts.

Solid porter. Heavily roasted coffee, light pleasant smoke character, some bitter coffee. Tastes bitter and kinda watery. Thin body, I suppose a porter should be. Looks beautiful - dark brown with a ruby tinge and a light khaki head with fantastic retention and lacing. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: DEC 12, 2014 Black pour, white head, nose is smokey, taste is smokey, chocolate, coffee, some vanilla

650ml bottle, no freshness date. Almost pitch black with a bubbly and thick mocha-coloured head that leaves a lacy ring around the edges. Lots of chocolate on the nose, caramel, light vanilla. Taste is full of roasted malt and dark chocolate with a slight hoppy bitterness and a charred, smoky and ashy finish. Palate is creamy and smooth but a little light. Medium carbonation. Pretty nice.
Pours a dark brown with a 3-fingered tan head.  Smells of chocolate, toast, licorice, floral.  Taste is a little smoky, sweet and bitter -  smoky roast malts, coffee, dark chocolate, floral hops.
Bottle.  Light wood smoke and chocolate aroma.  Dark brown color with small head.  Lightly smoky chocolate malt and mildly bitter herbal hops flavor.  Body a bit light.

Appearance - Body is very dark brown, but I am able to see through it when held to the light. A 1/2 finger of off-white foam forms, but fades to a ring around the glass quite quickly. Bubbles float lazily to the top, making this look like a more viscous beer.

Aroma - Smoke is not really a major player in the nose. There are toasted malt and chocolate notes as well as a touch of sharper burnt grains--possibly the smoke coming through.

T - Mildly sweet and sharp dark toasted malts up front. I get a sense of the richer chocolate and caramel malt body as well as the smokiness through the middle. Finish has a sharp bitterness from the hops/roasted grain.

Mouthfeel - Medium body with good carbonation. Finish is quite clean and leaves only a residual bitterness, but no sticky sugars.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2013 pours dark mahogany, basically black. Thick creamy off white head. Subtle hints of smoke, bitterness and dark malts on the nose. Flavor carries a lot of that character. Nice bitter vanilla, coffee and chocolate tones, complimented nicely by the smoke notes.

Aroma muy ligero y breve. Se logran detectar ligeras notas a chocolate y maltas tostadas.

En cuanto a la apariencia, cerveza de color prácticamente negro, carbonatación practicamente nula, cuerpo medio, corona de espuma media y de buena retención.

En boca notas dulces, maltas tostadas, bouqye a cafe y final ahumado.

Al paladar es una cerveza con un gran equilibrio entre sus notas dulces y amargas. Así mismo se logra una excelsa complejidad y un muy buen balance entre los sabores a café, maltas tostadas y sabores ahumados. Su final es de media duración y muy agradable.

Como resumen podemos señalar que se trata de una cerveza agradable, compleja y muy bien equilibrado. Las notas ahumadas se encuentran sin llegar a opacar los sabores a café y chocolate típicos del estilo. Cerveza cremos y elegante en donde solo quedó a deber en lo referente a su aroma.

Bottle very lovelily given to me by Dommod2011. Drunk yesterday before going out with spag bol. That worked, nice combo. Chocoffemeatypeatysmokypoky. Havent got time for this. Ratebeer yawn. Give it up. Not imminent but sometimes considered. By the way Dan, Im not gonna be a happy bunny if youre not drinking Rochefort 10 on Tuesday, even Tommann is in and hes not even on Twitter.

On tap in a shaker.  Pours very dark brown with a lacy, tan head.  Aroma of roasted malts, some chocolate and coffee, a little smokiness, and floral hops.  Flavor the same.  Smooth texture.  A pretty good porter.

From iphone beerlicious app:  Burnt dark chocolate.  Toasted notes.  Golden brown color.  Heavy bitterness to start.  Leveling off later.  Long duration.  Full body that feels thick and creamy.  Lively carbonation.

Tap. Bit thinner light khaki head; mahogany brown with some ruby highlights. Touch roasty, touch of earth, espresso and chocolate.  Small earthiness, a very faint hint of peat, chocolate and slight coffee finish.  Medium to lighter body.

bottle shared and from VT. pours very dark brown with a medium dark beige head, some retention and lacing. light peaty notes, roastiness and resinous hops. hint of sweetness and vanilla. nice leafy and resinous medium long finish. average to soft carbonation, medium body - oily. nice.

Really tasty beer!  Touch of chocolate in the taste and nose.  Very smooth with just enough hops to let you know it's a Stone.  The smoke isn't really noticeable(to me).

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

660 ml bottle shared with czar and friends. Pours an almost entirely opaque, orangeish dark brown with a short lasting white head. Smell is coffee, chocolate. Taste is chocolate, coffee, roast and pepper. Finish is quite smoky. Smoky. Coffee, bitterness, hops. And smoke, too. Body is average, mouthfeel is somewhat resinous. Weak carbonation. Very solid smoked porter!

Bottle. Chocolate, earthy/peaty, dark fruit aroma. Black brown with a small tan head. Earthy smoky malt, sweet chocolate, and coffee flavor with an acrid bitter finish.  Medium body, soft carbonation. Smoked beers are my favorite - I went into this one with high expectations and was disappointed by its averageness.

Poured from bottle.  Dark black appearance with lasting head, very nice lacing. At first sip strong smoke flavor comes out, with roasted and coffee notes.  Good beer, not a favorite Id go back to though.

Tasty offering, Nose is coffee, deep dark chocolate, touch of smoke and earthy hops.  Nice coffee and roasty malt character - the smoke is very subtle and rounds out the beer.  Bitterness is pretty high and you definitely get a decent hoppy finish with this one.  One of my favorite go tos.
Very little aroma. A slight sweetness. Pours very dark with light tan head. Smoky, roast coffee, very slight sweetness. Very little bitterness. A good solid porter.

Pint pour, deep dark and murky with full two finger tan head. Aroma is smooth roasted malts with light smoke and smooth sweetness. Flavor follows with smoke up front and a light lingering smooth malt character thats pretty decent. Light lacing on the glass, and nice for under six percent. Very drinkable overall.

Bottled. Pours dark brown with a frothy tan head. Light tones of smoke, some wood and roasted malt and some chocolate in aroma. Burnt wood, smoke, some sweetness and perhaps even hints of vanilla in taste.
Great smokey taste with hearty edge.  Very enjoyable with a Lebanon bologna and swiss cheese sandwich.
A decent porter although will not purchase again when there are so many better porters available. Taste is more enjoyable then their vanilla bean version.
Pours a dark black with a smokey aroma along with sweet malt. Great porter taste with a lot of smoke. Good to sip one, but couldnt do 2.
Beautiful big smoked brew. Huge roast and smoked notes on the nose. The taste is rich with a big smoked bbq nots, woody and earthy throughout> overall, rich and well composed.

On tap at UnionAle, santa barbara. Thick black pour, oatmeal colored head that was very dense. Bread scent and also a hint of Popsicle. Medium body, medium high carbonation. More breast taste, smokey finish that is mild and delicious. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle served in an English pint. Pours dark brown with amber hues. Short head and decent lace. Roasted malt, chocolate, and subtle smoke on the nose. Medium sweet, lightly roasted flavor. Medium-plus body, sticky texture and a sticky, bitter-roasty finish.

Pours cola black with a big foamy head that lasts as a nice covering. Some lacing. Nose is grassy maybe some pine and some roasted notes. Aromas of coffee, some slight chocolate and the smoke comes in the end with just the right touch. Creamy in the mouth with a bitter end to the taste. Good stuff for sure.

On tap at Chilihead BBQ in West Bridgewater. Came in dark with a nice frothy head. Smooth and malty, but not overly sweet. Not too smoky, as noted in the description. A perfect smooth, balanced beer to have with BBQ though. I ended up having two.

A very dark and smoky porter. Poured in to a Libbey Porter/Stout glass. Looks beautiful with a thick off-white head. Carbonation is just right in my opinion. Flavor got more complex as the beer warmed up. Would definitely repeat.

Falls flat for me. Not a bad beer, but lacking in flavor. Aroma is rather bland, with only slight evidence of roast or smoke. Flavor continues with very little chocolate or coffee flavor. Cant get much of the smoke here. Palate is thin for what I expected to be a bold porter. Just okay.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

1 pt bottle poured into pint glass. Dark brown body with off-white head which lingers well.
Smooth drinking with hints of coffee, chocolate and smokey wood. Another good Stone beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma of licorice, coffee, pine and grapefruit. Taste of dark chocolate, hint of smoke, dark fruit. Bitterness reminds of coffee.

65 cl bottle @ lusikka, EB 15.10.2011
Vertical With Smoked Porter With Vanilla Beans
Aroma is floury, sweet and rather stale with cocoa, some vanilla, baking powder and hints of smoke. Flavour is somewhat sweet with cocoa, some bun dough, nettles and hints of smoke. Somewhat bitter finish. A bit too sweet but good still.

65 cl bottle.
Pours deep dark ruby red, almost black color with small head. Aroma of very intense smoke, roasted and a bit burnt malts, some chocolate notes, cocoa powder and mild caramel. Flavor of sugar, cocoa powder, chocolate, some toasted malts and mild dark ripe fruits. Creamy smooth palate. A bit sweet but still very good.
5325

Pours ebony black with a rich head of beige.  Aroma of cherry smoked malt (Briess as apposed to Weyerman beechwood smoke action) with subtle hints of sweet malt, coffee, and chocolate.  Insanely balanced, perfect creamy smooth body, flavors of day old coffee, bittersweet chocolate and a bit of smokey phenols add a nice and dry tannin bite.  Finish is long and smooth and all out smoked coffee and chocolate.

Poured from a bomber into a Pint Glass

Aroma: roasted chocolate coffee beans, with a caramel hint on top.

Appearance: Dark dark red, with a two finger tan head.

Taste: there is a dry cocoa taste to it with light bitterness, leaves an alcohol taste and feel afterwards

Palate: Feels flat with a dry alcohol finish there is no hiding of the medium ABV here.

Overall: I like stouts and porters some Ive tried alaskan smoked porter before and this is completely different in what I was expecting, Its like that liquid smoke taste all up in your mouth not my favorite by far, but I would recommend it for someone else to try for themselves.

Bomber bottle poured a deep brown hue w a large tan rocky head fully lasting and excellent lacing. Aroma is medium in strength and very inviting  malts with some smoke and coffee. Primary taste is roasted hay, chocolate, malts, and milk. Full bodied w/ soft carbonation. Feels smooth with a roasted, sweet, and smokey finish. Very well balanced smoked porter.

Tap at a beerfest. Nice dark brown color. Nice warm aroma, chocolate and bit of caramel. A little more bitter than expected, but good roast taste. Something a bit off about the after taste, but good solid porter overall.

Enjoy by 8-29-2012.

A: Smoked Porter pours a very dark yet clear mahogany body, light is only barely visible through the body. A small tan head sits on top taking up just a small portion of the room in the glass, and has a creamy look to it.

S: The aroma at first came on a bit strong, I could smell dark chocolate a few inches away, but its now a bit more restrained a minute later. A light smokiness is here along with burnt chocolate and roasted malts, the aroma is very pleasing and balanced well.

T: A light smoked flavor greets my tongue on the intro and has a pronounced presence throughout, notably on the finish. A slightly burnt dark chocolate is also another flavor present here with a light coffee flavor. The balance is good overall. 

M: Medium bodied with abundant carbonation, near soda levels but not as sharp.

O: My bottle is past its prime so I will need to revisit this, still its a good beer and deserves a try.

On-tap a while back

A: Pours a rich mahogany color with a fluffy brown cap. Kind of opaque. Retention is pretty good

S: I was expecting more smoke, but nicely balanced - only a hint. I pick up on hops and a big dose of chocolate before the smoke. Big time roast, coffee, and caramel

T: Mellow beer. Still not a whole lot of smoke, more chocolaty and hoppy than anything. Balanced. Caramel and an underlying bitterness, nice depth

MF/O: Lighter body than I expected, bitterness lingers with chocolate. Overall, pretty drinkable stuff right here

Great black color, pretty clear complexion, good lasting head and great lacing.

Smells of candied caramel malts and subtle smoky aromas.

Tastes of great smoked malts, very complex malt flavors. Some hops overtones, enough to create a nice balance. Undertones of chocolate and coffee.

A real nice mouthfeel, smooth, rich, great smoky aftertaste.

A great drinking porter. Highly recommended.

I wanted to love this smoked porter but it wasnt quite as great as I had hoped. Contrary to most other reviews I found this porter to have too dominant of a smokey taste. Its possible it had been perhaps sitting on the shelf for quite a while so that taste might have brought out the smoke. Other than that it had a great mouth feel and aroma, I just couldnt get over the smoke. A little more subtle and it would have been sublime.
Draft to pint. Looks good; somewhere between dark brown and black with beige head. Smells and tastes smoky and malty with an average mouthfeel. A good example of the style.
Generous head and nose.  A generous beer which is good to end the night with (almost)

22 oz bottle. Dark brown pour with a thick, light tan head. Aroma of milk chocolate, roasted coffee and very faint smoke. Flavor is rich, roasty malt, some bitter coffee and a bit of acidic smoke. Medium to full body with average carbonation and a long, dry finish. This is a nice porter, the smoked character is very light but its there.

Poured from a 22 oz bottle purchased at Stone Brewing Co.  Very dark brown/black with a rich tan head.  Aroma is malty, chocolate, roasted coffee, and very light smoke.  Very enjoyable to drink.  Slightly sweet, and very light bitter finish.  Very nice lacing, more sticky than expected.

AGED 2 YEARS Brown. Slight amber. Small lacy head. Muted and slightly malty nose with a whisper of roasty smoke. Nice mouth. Creamy with a touch of complex smokiness left. Almost medicinal  Woody bark and dark roast finish. Needs chocolate. Very interesting but I think it is better fresh. 

---That dog will hunt!

Bottle. Pours an extremely dark brown with a small head. Subtle smoky flavor to the nose on this one, with much more of the smokiness coming through in the flavor. VERY easy drink, especially for a porter. Great brew.
very nice light little beer, the smokedness shone out and realy came through, quite a light mouth feel, very very drinkable roasty yet light
Definitely has a smokey flavor. My first porter reminds me slot of a stout. Had this out of a bottle from earth fare

Aroma: Deep rich earth aroma, Notes of soy sauce and autumn leaves. 

Appearance: Black, deep orange tinges when held to light, tan head.

Taste: Heavy, notes of dark coffee and dark coco, the finish has notes of smoke and char and it is only in this where you note why it is smoked porter.

Palate: Thick almost oily like cold vodka, moderate carbonation and a lasting finish

Overall: I am starting to think stone can do no wrong, I have only had 3 beer by them but they are all fantastic this one would co fantastic with any form of grilled beef or even breakfast meats.

Bottle pour, tan foamy head, nice red/brown hues, very appealing.
Balanced aromas of mild smoked grains, some cherry and tootsie roll.
Was expecting more chocolate, tobacco and coffee. Most porter styles tend to be consistently prominent in those three aromas, but this one was not.
Body was on the thin side, easily drinkable, not much carbonation. Tastes leaned toward sweet, with a bit more hops presence than other porters.
I would have to rate this as a "light" porter overall. Certainly a good quality brew, but just lacking the usual brawn of most porters.

Poured into a tulip glass.

A: Pours a very dark burgundy color with good clarity in spite of its darker tint. Particularly, I like that its not as pitch black as some of the other porters Ive had (especially the ones that try to think theyre stouts). The head is a three finger offwhite color with decent retention/lacing.

S: Judging from the smell, this isnt as robust as what Im used to from a porter. Nonetheless, there is plenty of rich dark fruit, chocolate, caramel, molasses, and only a faint touch of smoke.

T: I could kvetch about the smoky flavor not being as expressive as it could be, but as a man who isnt fan of bacon or smoked meats (though I do like my BBQ every once in a while), I like that its only a subtle hint that lingers throughout the drinking experience while never overpowering the porter base. Aside from the smoke, there are subtle hints of chocolate, molasses, dark fruit, and hints of coffee with a faint strike of hops on the finish. While I enjoy this quite a bit, there are some small niggles all around that keep it from being great, chief among which is the lack of robustness I like in a porter. Then again, maybe Im spoiled by Fullers London Porter, but I still think this could use a stronger roast character overall.

M: This has a lighter body at first, but it thickens up near the finish, leaving the tongue rather chalky feeling. The chalky texture detracts from the character slightly. The dryness on the finish builds gradually. Good carbonation.

O: Im not going to whine about this not being robust enough, Im just going to say its a solid porter throughout that never overpowers the tongue with smoke notes. Definitely worth a try. Id get it again - if only because I think its a fantastic pairing with BBQ chicken.

Had high expectations for this beer after the aroma had my mouth watering. However, I was thoroughly surprised that the aroma did not transfer to the taste. Too much vanilla for my liking. Had an off taste for some reason. It just didnt tste like a Porter.

You can certainly smell this one from several feet away. The aroma is mouthwateringly perfect with strong milk chocolate, black liquorice, dark fruit, fresh brewed coffee, and slight caramel. Pours a dark brown with a nice two finger tan head. Taste is bold and deep, with dark chocolate, black liquorice, strong roasted malts, and a very nice dark fruit finish. There is a definite smokey taste and aroma. But unlike most other smoked beers, its not upfront or overpowering. Very nice, creamy palate that is balanced perfectly. Overall I would have to say this is the gold standard for smoked porters. Absolutely one of the best porters on the market!

22 oz. Bottle. My favorite smoked brew yet! Just as the description says, the smokiness is "an ELEMENT of the character rather than being THE character," and thats what I loved about this beer. Victory Otto for example was way too smokey for me, like drinking a campfire, but this beer had the perfect touch of smoke to compliment the other flavors. 

Medium coffee bitter aroma with a campfire smokey (not overpowering) note. Dark brown/black pour with a big foamy head to film to ring and thick lacing, pretty much everything you could ask in the appearance of a beer. Thick bodied, creamy with a slight fizz feel. Perfect amount of smoke on the flavor, right up front, to a roasted coffee bitter flavor and a touch of dark chocolate.

Poured from a bomber into a glass. This beer poured dark with a frothy, light tan head. The aroma was barely smoky, but reminded more of an esb than a porter. The taste was started vanilla and rolled into a drier vanilla. Very good. The palate was of a lighter beer. It looked a lot heavier than it turned out being. Overall, good beer and will buy on a regular basis.

Tap, the pub, Orlando. Excellent dry black beer, with chocolate and roast malt very obvious. Slightly acrid, slips off the tongue very nicely. no heaviness, went down well in a muggy Orlando downpour. Smoke is mininal and works well.

22 oz bottle pours an opaque  black with apersistenty tan head and good lacing.  Aroma is full of roasted malts, chocolate.vanillay coffee, almonds, and perhaps some faint smoke.  Body is full.  Mouthfeel is creamy and sticky, without much carbonation.  A great porter Im likely to try again.

Bottle. Black, decent head. Roasted notes, some coffee, chocolate, beachwood. Soft palate, a bit thinner than expected. Overall a nice warming  experience. Thinner than expected, but soft and welcoming.-- bb/h

Poured from a 22oz into a tullip glass. Pours a nice dark color with a tan head that lasts a while and leaves great lacing. Aroma of chocolate, creamy, roasted malt, seems a little light on aroma but a good one overall, no smoke noted. Flavor is full of body, chocolate, better through and through, I think i can taste the smoke. A nice dry bitter finish. Nice fully body overall. A decent beer, not sure If I would by it again though, looking forward to trying the vanilla and chipotle versions.

22oz ---> shaker.  Pours a cola black with a tiny tan head that disappears quickly.  Aroma is heavy on coffee and roasted malt.  Taste is kind of chalky cocoa with a hint of metal.  You only get the smallest bit of smoke as you get to the end of the glass.  Palate is kind of thin and watery.  Ive passed this one up hundreds of times, but it will now be in my regular rotation.
The smokey aroma is subtle. Subtle smokey aroma as well.  Tickles the tastebuds but does not overpower.
Bottle from SED. Deep black with a short lived head. Aroma is toasted creamy roast. Flavour is quite bitter, dry chocolate with a little smoke in the finish
Draft. Great smoke! deepest red-brown, sweet tart nose. Full, balanced body with plenty of smoky malts. Smooth and incredibly tasty.

65cl bottle from Brewdog. Poured black with a brown head, great looking. Aroma has oatmeal, roasted malt, strong coffee, but also some vegetables. Very smooth moutfheel. Roasted flavor with coffee and cocoa. Dry long roasted finish. Good porter.

Bottle 1pint 6oz
Pours dark brown with very high creamy beige head. Some lacing. Aroma is of smoke, roasted malt, chocolate. Taste is of smoke, roasted malt, sweetness, chocolate. Overall: Bitter finish. A pretty good porter. Smoke is not overwhelming, and I like that.
On tap at Stone. Pours deep red brown with a light brown foam. Sweet aroma of chocolate and expresso. Chocolate flavors dominate. Good mouthfeel and carbonation. Finish is dry and slightly bitter.

Picked up a bottle at Woodmans in Rockford, IL in early 2012 since it is no longer sold in Wisconsin. Pours a dark brown color with off white foamy head. Has a mild smoked scent. Taste is robust yet still sweet with caramel malts finishing with a smoking flavor that delivers a hoppy after taste.
Bottle from Brewdog shop. Black color, brown head. Roasty, malty taste with chocolate, coffee, smoke, raisins and a bit of caramel. Rich, smooth body. Very roasty finish. Great porter.
Bottle. Nice head with medium duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are roast malt, chocolate, coffee, hops and notes of smoke. Nice and smooth.
Nice beer. Tastes and smells of cigarettes, molasses, hops, and spent grain. Ends minerally.

Dark brown/black color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, coffee, & light chocolate; Flavor of roasted sweet malt, coffee, chocolate, some hops, and light dark fruit; Finish is slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; Overall, pretty good porter.

A - Pours a dark brown black color with a finger of frothy khaki colored head. The head fades down fairly slowly leaving behind some nice lacing.

S - Aroma is a mix of roasted chocolate malts with some smoke and licorice, and a touch of coffee.

T - Starts off with a mix of roasted chocolate malts with some lactose sweetness and a bit of smoke. Through the middle, some licorice comes through with a bit of bitter coffee and a bit more smoke. The finish is a mix of smoke, roasted chocolate, some earthy hops, and a touch of lactose sweetness.

M - Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Feels smooth with a roasted, sweet, and smokey finish.

D - Very drinkable. Really nicely balanced smoked porter. The chocolate malts are really nice with the smoke flavor.
Impressive head retention on a smooth finish, great color and body. Hoppy after taste

Slightly out of style, picking up roasted barley in the mouth and nose.  High bitterness and roasted malt levels comparable to a stout.  Aroma is awesome.  Slight smokiness in the nose and more in the taste, you have to fill your mouth with it to really enjoy the smokiness.   Overall it is a good beer but not living up to its current rating in the 98th percentile.  Warm with a cigar and this beer is even better.

Pours black with a thin head. Aroma of smoke, roasted malts and some carmel notes. Taste is very smokey with hints of charcoal. Some sweet notes. Mouthfeel is thin in a good way but coats the mouth in the finish with a nice smoked malty sweetness. Smoked is spot on. If you like this style of beer, this a must try.

Really good tasting porter slightly bitter entry with a mellow smoked aftertaste...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle poured an opaque dark brown with a medium sized tan head that dissapated quickly and intense lacing.  Aroma is smoke, roasted caramel malts, and hints of cocoa and bakers chocolate.  Taste is bitter chcolate and roasted malt upfront followed by big smoke flavor.  Huge creamy mouthfeel with smoke and palatable bitterness lingering long after each sip.
This is a more bitter porter than some. Its not too bitter. Nice flavor found in traditional dark beer. Overall good.

I was rather excited to try this beer, Im not sure if I got an old one or what. But for $5.50 it was rather disappointing. Carbonation was poor, could not even form any head during the pour, NONE. Other people mention the smokey smell and flavor, well the one I had had NO smoky flavor at all. Malt seemed to be unbalanced, very sweet. Hops did not seem to be as claimed for the IBU rating. This beer was so bad I thought several times about contacting the company to make a complaint.

Draught at Aces and Ales, LV. Deep brown/light black liquid with medium tan head. Aroma of smoke, roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate and biscuit. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of roasted malt and smoke. Medium to full bodied with medium carbonation. Quite balanced. Nice.

Sample glass from 650ml bottle. Nice looking pour, pitch black with a caramel head. Aroma was not strong; chocolate, coffee and earthy smoke. Taste is much the same but fuller. Body was medium to heavy. Overall, the smoke in this was more balanced than many rauchbiers, and didn't go fishy or bacony, but I still don't quite get the appeal of adding smokey flavour to beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a deep, dark, murky brown with a respectable rocky tan head.  Aromas of roasted coffee and a hint of smoked wood.  Solid, complex flavor thats just a touch harsh before smoothing out.  Creamy body with a nice finish.
Pours a very dark color from the bottle. Very nice porter. Strong smoky, malt characteristics with nice chocolate, caramel and coffee notes.

16.6oz bottle - pours very dark brown with tan head.  Nose is roasty, smoky, and chocolate.  Flavor adds caramel, coffee and resin hops.  Taste is sweet to the lips but ends fairly bitter.  Dry lips ensue.  Medium to full body with oily mouthfeel.  Much better than I expected.  Areal treat.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2013 Poured from a 660ml bottle, very dark, black in the centre with mahogany edges. Couldnt get much in aroma, some smokiness and coffee. Wonderful taste, a fantastic balance of malt, chocolate, coffee and a hint of smoke. Great mouthfeel, medium bodied, smooth with a bitter finish. An excellent porter, would definitely recommend.

Bottle-22oz into pint glass: Pours a dark brown-black color; Tan frothy head, Medium creamy body. Aroma of toasted malt, coffee, & light chocolate; Flavor of roasted sweet malt, coffee, chocolate and some dark fruit; Hints of smoke; not overdone, Nicely balanced; Overall good porter.

Simply a delight. It is smooth, finished and not overly heavy. When allowed to linger on the palate the nuanced flavors really discern themselves. Even for the "lighter" beer drinkers this opens up new experiences. No lasting bitterness and doesnt overwhelm the faint of beer. Accents perfectly with a grilled burger or steak. Character and complexity deepens as it waits. Truly one of the best I have enjoyed.

Aroma is a beautiful mix of toffee, coffee and a slight smoky smell. Poured jet black with a huge beige head that stuck around for a while. Taste is coffee, chocolate and a bit of smoky goodness with a quick finish. Feels medium bodied with a nice creamy coating in your mouth.

great pour, huge bubbles, huge head, taste is awesome, super flavorful, hits you with hops at the end, chocolate, and that slight hint of smoke making it almost fruity like a black IPA. Awesome, one of the best porters I have had.
Pours a lovely head.  Smokey chocolate aroma.  Perfect amount of smokiness (I hate beers that taste like bacon).  One of their best offerings!

just as the label states, smoked character in the background-just enough to let you know it is there without being the obnoxious drunk at the party you cant ignore. Solid porter base, easy drinkability.

Tasted from tall bottles into snifter. It poured a mostly clear dark brown color with creamy, thick, lasting beige foam and lots of lace. Dark toast, roasted barley, smores, tart fruit, tangy hops, dark coffee and chocolate. Definitely smoky, but not overwhelmingly so. Medium body and carbonation. Bready, "chewy" mouthfeel. Overall, a magnificent balance. Complex aftertaste eventually finished dry and slightly charcoal-y. Delicious.

Poured into a snifter. Almost black with a good inch and half of tan head that held strong.

Smells of smoke (obviously) and a lot of rich malt, ripe dark fruit and chocolate. The smoke compliments here, not dominating.

It tastes like a porter with an undercurrent of smoke. It is there from beginning to end but never the main show. There is good malt, woody taste and a nice bitter kick in the middle.

Smooth and creamy texture. Moderate carbonation and medium bodied. A little less carbonation would bump this up in my book.

Overall I really enjoyed this beer. I liked the low profile of the smoke; quite different from most other smoked beers. You cannot go wrong here.

Dark brown colour, no head whatsoever. Soft mouthfeel with very little carbonation. Great beer like taste with a strong aftertaste with chili. I like hot peppers so I might be biased but this is a very good beer.

Pour a deep dark brown and a short lived tan head. The nose is malty. The taste is not that smoky. It was  more hoppy (surprise!) and bitter. Ok, but not something I would necessarily drink often. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

aroma, smokey chocolate, pours dark with persistent small head and some lace. Taste chocolate light smoke flavor and coffee. medium body carbonated,  slight bitter. somewhat dry chocolate finish. would like a little more pronounced smoke flavor but in all a very solid porter

Pours jet black into my bruery snifter with a paperthin head that sticks around. Aroma of smoked malts, hops and sweet coffee. Taste follows the nose, this is a really tasty drink, easy to drink, goes down smooth. I could drink a lot of this. Great price as well!
Beige head and roasty malted aroma. Not so smokey taste with bit of chocolate. Full bodied with oily and creamy texture.  Carbonation is rather average. Tiny bitter finish.

Dark brownred, yellow foam that lasts. Aroma is sour with a hint of malt, hey with light smoke. Taste is smoky with chocolate, coffee, bitter coffee aftertaste that lasts medium. Medium body and high carbon.

Poured out of a 22oz bomber into a pint glass.

Pours a very dark brown, almost black with just a tiny head that is quick to fade. Not really any lacing.

Aroma of consists largely of dark chocolate with a touch of coffee. The smoke is detectable but it is not overwhelming like some rauchbiers. All in all, though, I find the nose to be somewhat weak.

The taste more than makes up for the lack of aroma with tons of coffee and chocolate along with a decent dose of smoke. The smoke is much more noticeable compared to the nose and it compliments the other flavors nicely. It does have a slight medicinal note from the peat but it works. The moderate to high bitterness come in midway through and grows towards the finish and is quite noticeable on the roof of the mouth.

Overall I am impressed with this beer as I am with all of Stones brews. The smoke adds a nice layer to a typical porter and makes this a really outstanding beer.

Originally reviewed: 1/11/10. Had this on tap at the First Street Draught House in town. Came out a very dark black with some ruby highlights on the edges. Nice creamy tan head on top. Left beautiful sip rings. Smoke is surprisingly absent in the nose. I was expecting a smoky, roasted scent, but in its place was just some cocoa tones with a sweet finish.

Very creamy body on this beer. Carbonation level was low. Smooth. No smoke in the flavor either. What makes this smoked? This tastes like a regular porter to me. Some light coffee bitterness, mild chocolate flavors, and roasted malts on the finish. Sorry, but this was boring when I expected something a little more original.

Roasted malts and barley on the nose with a hint of coffee with very little smoke present. In the mouth the standard porter flavours dominate at first. This quickly evolves into a astringent bite from the smoke but never totally dominant. The real quality part of this beer is the finish where smoke and sweetness evolve with an almost salty tang present throughout.

Refrigerated bottle set on the counter for a bit.  Pours translucent really dark brown with medium brown hightlights and massive fluffy beige head.  Some fluffy lacing, medium body, and light roasted malt aroma.  Taste is roasted malt, some milk chocolate, some smoke, and bitter hop finish.  Pretty easy to drink and one of the best porters I have had.

Bottle. Dark brown, average and mostly diminishing light brown head. Moderate malty - lightly wheaty and sweetish aroma, roasted malt and some coffee, faint smokiness. Body is medium, malty and sweetish flavor, some caramel, roasted malt and some coffee, light hoppyness. Finish is average, malty and lightly sweetish, light caramel, some roasted malt and light coffee, some hoppyness, faint smokiness. More coffee than hoppyness/smokiness.
A Sweet  and well structurated Foam. Full Stout style! Not to strong and not to easy to drink. Coffee and barley smell. The smoked feeling is really strong but not intrusive.
Poured from a bomber. Lots of smoky roast malt, coffee and a decent head. Lingering mild bittersweet finish. Overall a quality porter.

Bomber. Pours a deep, dark brown with frothy chocolate head. Nothing too overpowering in the aroma, chocolate, light coffee. Taste is light roasted coffee and chocolate, hints of toffee, nuttiness. As you swallow the smokiness really comes thru, also in the aftertaste. As it warmed a bit, the flavors were ehanced. Great finish to a very good porter!

Stone Smoked Porter has a very thick, creamy, beige head and a dark brown appearance, with some lacing. The aroma is faint, but one is able to detect dark-roasted and bready barley malt. Taste is of dark-roasted, charred malt, charcoal, and some sweet bread. I did not pick up on any hop bitterness with this beer. Mouthfeel was pretty light and watery, and Stone Smoked Porter finishes semi-dry, creamy, and very easy drinking. Overall, this is a good beer. RJT.

Pours dark brown with a sudsy tan head. Smells of chocolate and smoke. Taste is chocolate up first, then moves to coffee really quickly, and is then dominated by smoke. Medium-bodied with a smooth, wet texture and mild mouth-carbonation, Stone Smoked Porter finishes with a murderous amount of smoke.
Bottle. Dark brown pour with light head. Coffee and chocolate bathed in smoke, toast. Crispy, dry, slightly bitter finish. Mostly smoke.
Pours black with a small off white head. Aroma is chocolatey, with a slight smokijness. Taste is chocolatey and coffee with some smoke flavor towards the finish, Medium bodied.

Aroma: Smells like a weak porter, not a lot of chocolate, not a lot of caramel or the other malt hits honestly just a tiny hint of smoke too. Appearance is nice, black with a light beige head that lasts forever. Taste is a bit better than aroma since the smoke comes across a lot better in the form of a acidic hit on the back of my tongue. Palate is a bit astringent due to the smoke but that is probably what its supposed to do. Overall Im not sure about this. I like the idea Im just not sure I actually like the effect.

A - pours dark mahogany with high of white head. Very little lacing. S - aromas of toasted malts, smoke, hint of antiseptic cleaner and alcohol. M - light medium bodied brew. Airy. Smoky and lingering toasted malts. T - smoke and toasted malts up front, hints of caramels, sweet malts and oak chips, coffee. O - Fairly simplistic porter. 6/6+
Pours a nice dark color. There was a rather small head. The smell was of nice roasted malts. The taste is a mixture of mocha and smoke. Nice smooth mouthfeel.

You know youre drinking a top brass Porter from the off here. Generous churning of porter moreish malt coming through a welcoming nose with a generous brown profligated head. Strong milk choclate body, not too dense and not too dark. Suprisingly refreshing initial taste for a smoked porter, elements of cashew and cola. This isnt one of your Bamberg bacon roll/burnt sausage efforts. (Bottle, Krishs Tasting)

Pours black.  Sweet apetizing aroma.  Taste is heavy smoke and dark malt.  Little to mild sweetness notes come through during initial taste.  Body is heavy and flemmy.  Lots of smokiness though is this guys redeeming quality.

Purple black with dark tan head
Aroma is an understated blend of smoke and dark roasted chocolate...
Flavour is wonderfully smoky, chocolate, a little coffee, a hint of hops...ashy at the end.
A great porter....sweet at the tip of the tongue and bitter at the back.
Excellent.

Pours dark brown and ruby with a very small white head. Nose is slightly chocolate and smoke. Little piney and nutty too. Some fruit as well. Taste is sweet and slightly bitter. Mouthfeel is crisp and clean. Decent aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown with a nice tan head.The aroma is malty and smoky with earthy hints of coffee and chocolate. Well balanced between lightly burnt/roasty and smokey sweet malt and good bittering hop flavor. Medium bodied.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2012 Pours a nice dark chocolate with a thick off-white head.  Smells a bit chocolatey.  Tastes roastey and a tad chocolatey with a bunch of smoke flavor.  This would be a very good brew....but the smoke tastes lingers too long for my tastes.

0.65l bottle from myBrewerytap. This one pours a nice looking dark brown body with a big and lasting almost creamy tan head. Nice dark roasted aroma with lots of chocolate, and its also quite dark-hoppy. Nice subtle tones of smoked malts and even some hints of cold coffee and sweet caramel. Quite delicious aroma on this one - and it was surprisingly hoppy. Oh yeah, the smoke really comes forward in the flavor. Much more so than in the aroma. Also here lots of good chocolaty tones mixed with dark roasted malts all packed in a medium-bodied, average carbonated body. Lasting almost ashy and roasted finish on this one. Really balanced with a good amount of hops. This is really enjoyable and just what I wanted right about now! 05.03.2012

bottle - Pours deep brown and light beige head. Nose of roasted malts and smoked meat. Medium body with medium sweetness - nice roast and hoppy sensation. Flavour of chocolate and dark fruits. Medium finish, sweet and roasted. Only in the end some hoppiness.

Definitely a smoky porter.  Extremely smooth with a finish that keeps you coming back.  This is a porter you could drink all night.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Paid $5.50 for this last month at HungerMountain Co-Op. Poured into a Duvel Tulip

A - Poured a light brown out of the bottle but looks dark brown now that its in the tulip. 2-finger coffee colored creamy head.

S - Smoked malts, cocoa, earthiness and walnuts

T - Wow. Wonderful smokiness in here. Nice balance of smoke, chocolate and roasted malts. 

M - 80% Carbonation on a mouth swish, medium bodied and a smokey linger. The finish is a little too dry though.

O - Fantastic. I would imagine that on-tap and fresh, this bottle is fantastic.

Stone does it right every time....great pour, huge bubbles, huge head, taste is awesome, super flavorful, hits you with hops at the end, chocolate, and that slight hint of smoke making it almost fruity like a black IPA.  Awesome, one of the best porters I have had.
On tap.  Comes black with a nice tan head.  Aroma of chocolate, coffee, malt, and smoke.  Taste is roasted sweet malt, chocolate, smoke, and dark fruit.  Full bodied and well balanced.  Very good.

Tasted at NYC Craft Beer Festival. Nose is toasty, smoky, vanilla, cola, root beer. Flavor mirrors the nose. Ultra smooth, loads of vanilla and mellow chocolate and milky coffee. Chalky mouthfeel on finish, slightly bitter and milky. Stone Rules!!!!!
UPDATED: MAR 2, 2012 Dark dark brown color. Sweet chocolate and coffee smell. Taste is same with light bitterness. Smooth smoky roast flavor.
black color, tan head, aroma of coffee, burnt malt, smokey peat, flavor is coffee, burnt toast, woodsy smokey peat flavor, very solid porter

Poured into a snifter.

3.5 A: A good bit of carbonation in this one. Black color. Three fingers of frothy/creamy light tan head. Retention is good and sparse irregular lacing is left.

3.5 S: Im a bit disappointed with the amount of smoke in this. I expected something a bit more badass from Stone. Anyway, it still smells good. Chocolate with a moderate neutral malt sweetness. A touch of graininess. Smoke is subdued, but it does add a touch of bacon. If this was 10X stronger, it be damn good.

3.0 T: This is a well crafted brew, but it isnt very exciting. Subtle chocolate, subtle roast, and a subtler smoke. The strongest flavor is neutral malt sweetness.

4.0 M: Despite a medium body, this has a lot of creaminess. Good moderate carbonation. Very nice here.

3.5 D: Stone was one of my first loves, but ever since drinking the beers of hundreds of breweries, they dont seem too impressive anymore. Sometimes I wish I had an undeveloped palate again. In any case, this is a tasty, easy drinker.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 01-25-2012 23:59:06

Black pour produced a superb head one that laced the pint glass all the way down. A chocolate malt aroma transcends over into the taste, along with coffee, light charcoal, burnt toast and the infamous smoky peat finish that gives you a small kick in the sack.
